title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: quick and minimal questioning with only interview question part being strictly on phone, without in person interview or questioning process. was given offer on the phone shortly after initial conversation with the recruiter. then went for tour and met manager to discuss next steps
Interview Questions: tell us why you chose nursing

title: Inventory Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: The application process was simple. I was able to get an email asking for when it would be a good time to do a phone interview. After the actual phone interview, they got to me pretty quickly with an offer.
Interview Questions: The questions were pretty straightforward and ones you expect to be asked in a interview: answered questions about previous job experience, why I was moving on from the current position I had, they asked how I handled a difficult situation in the work place and what the outcome was, etc.

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy Very friendly environment Great setting They asked a few questions about jobs history and scheduling information They offered me the job on the spot it was a very good process
Interview Questions: How do you do in difficult situations

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application online. Scheduled a phone interview over email a couple days later. Completed interview over the phone (took about 45 minutes), offer letter sent the same day. Interview consisted of mostly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Discuss a time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: First speak with the recruiter for a phone interview to discuss pay & then meet with hiring manager for a interview. Interview questions are based on banners core values. Was asked a handful of questions and asked to give situation, task, action and results.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you faced a difficult problem and had to resolve it quickly?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter was super nice- interview Qs are all standard questions that you would get anywhere. Recruiter gives offer on the spot and tells you everything you need to know about the unit or facility that you want to work at and does their best to accommodate your preferences
Interview Questions: Name a time where you and a coworker got in an argument

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was demanding and unforgiving. the times to come in for orientation, onboarding paperwork were difficult to meet especially when you were still trying to hold down a job prior to finding a new one.
Interview Questions: Behavioral based questions were asked regarding conflict

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer stated they only promote from within and do not see how outside medical knowledge correlates. Did not seem interested in even having an interview other than the recruitment team had said I was a good fit. When I brought up my degree in the field, they repeatedly stated they don’t have a degree and prefer to see an underdog story where they rose from the bottom to succeed.
Interview Questions: What is an example of how you overcame bias in when implementing new ideas.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took a week or so. I applied online, got an email 3 days later to schedule for a phone interview. Interviewed and got an offer right after. The recruiter was super nice.
Interview Questions: 1. Tell me about a time you had constructive criticism and how did you 2. Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient. 3. Tell me about a time you were courageous and jumped into to promote patient care.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Questions are behavioral based and based on their 6 core values: customer obsessed, disciplined focused, continuously earn trust, courageously innovative, to name 4 of them. Always have the patient at the center of your decision making.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter will contact you by phone number and ask standard questions. From there, an interview will take place if both parties agree! I heard back after the interview fairly quickly as well.
Interview Questions: Do you have any outside business that would interfere with the working hours

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: It starts with a phone interview. Then from there you move forward to an in person interview, possibly with a panel. They then ask a few behavioral type questions. It last about 30 minutes. Then they reach out to you with in a week either with a denial or an offer.
Interview Questions: They ask a few behavioral questions

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: There was a preliminary phone screen with HR. Later contacted for follow up 1 hour panel interview with team for discussion of responsibilities. Basic statistics, coding and visualization questions were asked.
Interview Questions: What is the order by function used for in SQL?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with interviewer . Apply online then you will receive email from recruiter asking you to list unit choices. The recruiter will then contact you for a phone interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Banner?

title: CMA (AAMA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: First they emailed me, then I had a phone interview. She asked the normal questions for an MA. Then they said I would get an in person or virtual interview next. I got another email to schedule that.
Interview Questions: Are you vaccinated and have BLS?

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then in person one on one interview they asked pretty simple questions and were respectful. There was only one question that I did not expect and it was describe a time where you didn’t follow company policy or it was difficult for you to.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself in three words

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Video call with manager and nurse. Very positive experience. The manager described the position in detail. Only three situation type questions. They provided time to introduce self and work experience and time for questions.
Interview Questions: How did you manage conflict with a co-worker?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy and straightforward. Questions are related to previous work experience, how you handle situations, what you have done previously to build relationships, how you handle difficult situations, what you see for a future with Banner, why do you want to work for them.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the company's website online. Contact was then made by a recruiter. The recruiter provide a schedule of availability for a phone interview. Received an email that my application was denied.
Interview Questions: what is important to you?

title: Cardiovascular Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took place over the phone because I was applying from out of state. Some was one on one with management and the other portion was on speakerphone with some of the team members.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Healthcare Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: I went through the interview process and then was notified that the job is "on hold" and no longer available. And then, month later, they reposted this job again. Needless to say, I didn't reapply. Waste of everyone's time in my opinion.. Poor planning produces poor performance..
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience Why do you want to work at our company Salary expectation

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed during COVID so it was a phone interview. I believe they are now doing in person interviews. Hospitals are short staffed so offered position during interview. Question such as experience with patient care and conflicts with coworkers were asked.
Interview Questions: Name a time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Financial Clearance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: They contacted me for a Quick Phone Call with HR via Email. I was able to pick a date and time that worked best for my schedule. The gal from HR called me at the scheduled time. The call lasted less than 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: Banners policy is that all employees are vaccinated for Covid including remote workers. Would this be a problem for you?

title: Healthcare Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Banner Health in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: You get a call and once they ask you your experience. It’s really easy if you have been in the customer service industry and healthcare. Always ask your pay and hours
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked in customer service

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with a recruiter, then an in person panel interview with the team I’d be working for. Friendly discussion during the interview, no real hard questions
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: HIM Tech III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was alright, there just was no follow-up after the interview. There were 2 interviews from Human Resources and the manager from Health Information Management. The interview consisted of six questions, two from each interviewer.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Network Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call from recruiter discussing compensation. A week later followed up with a  Microsoft teams link with hiring manager. Informed they should be making their decision at the end of the week and if chosen then should hear from recruiter again.
Interview Questions: Be prepared to study Banner Health's mission and values. They will correlate those along with behavior questions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. Interviewed with recruiter. Asked about my work experience and offered me the job right away. Allowed me to select the unit I wanted as well. 10/10 interview. Was great.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have to offer?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Spoke to a very nice recruiter, interview was about 15-20 minutes. She asked me around 5 questions. She was very polite and friendly and took notes during the interview. I got the job
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a nurse?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview had the normal questions. Tell about a time you overcame hardship.  Tell about a time you had a coworker that was a challenge and how you dealt with them.  Tell about a success you have had a previous job.
Interview Questions: Interview had the normal questions. Tell about a time you overcame hardship.  Tell about a time you had a coworker that was a challenge and how you dealt with them.  Tell about a success you have had a previous job.

title: Echo Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Banner Health in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: 15 minute phone screening, then you get told you'll have an in person. However, don't get your hope too high because an hour before your interview the recruiter will call you and say "We've cancelled your interview, the position has been filled so sorry" and ruin your whole day. The job post I applied to was up for three months, they decided on their first applicant before even interviewing anyone else. It would have been okay if they interviewed everyone, then went from there. To have someone have their hopes especially a new grad, that they might have the chance to interview and meet new people and get the experience just to have the rug pulled from under them, is just so not okay. Also, i'm not the only one who this has happened to.
Interview Questions: What is a short term goal, and a long term goal.

title: Revenue Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: You schedule a brief phone interview with the recruiter then your information is forwarded to  the hiring leader. If you are selected then a video (Microsoft teams) interview is scheduled.
Interview Questions:
Where you see yourself in 3-5 years?
Tell me about yourself

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: A nurse recruiter spent 45 minutes with me asking some questions and telling me about the new grad program. I, however, did not get to ask question directly to a nurse manager about the position.
Interview Questions: What are you long term career goals?

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Met with shift supervisor and then HR representative. Both were formal interviews that went well. Typical questions from both individuals. Not stressful and met some staff afterwards. Overall Great Experience
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult patient care scenario that involved a provider and explain how you dealt with it?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple and quick. They will call you to do a 30 minute interview. After that interview they will talk about pay and benefits. They will ask you when can you start and your job experience.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where you and your teammate had a disagreement.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview took place on Zoom. Approximately 30 people were divided into 2 breakout rooms. There, everyone was asked the same question -- we were asked to describe ourselves and why we wanted to volunteer there.
Interview Questions: Tell us a bit about yourself.

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy-going despite questions about moral decisions in terms of how you would respond to conflicts between employees, patients, and situations. Very low-stress environment. Took over a month after the initial interview to be confirmed as having landed the job (actually 2 weeks for this) and getting a schedule. This is not uncommon, coworkers have told me they experienced the same so don't feel discouraged, just don't quit your job after they tell you you're on the company payroll until you actually get a schedule!
Interview Questions: If a patient is upset about something that you don't know about what would you do?

title: Behavioral Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: This interview involved an online application, two phone screenings and then an in-person behavioral health based interview questionnaire with a hiring manager.  These questions were all experiential based and focused on interpersonal effectiveness.
Interview Questions: Tell me about an experience where you were given a tight deadline.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Apply to position, speak with HR, interview with management, receive offer, negotiate, accept or decline. Straight forward, they are a non profit, don’t like to negotiate but will listen. Staff is usually always great. The business is what people usually have issues with.
Interview Questions:
Strength & weakness 

Difficult situation 

What would you do in “x” situation

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Round table interview with scenario questions. Nothing too intense, but they liked a lot of detail. Engaged multiple levels of staff in process. Not much more to say but this esquires 30 words do I’ll keep tying.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a difficult situation

title: Medical Imaging Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone and really easy, questions based about my interests and what I want from this job. Recruiter connected me to manager and went through options of where I wanted to go
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your interests

title: ER Medical Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was fine, they ghosted me after 1 interview and emailed me after 6 months to say they hired someone else for the position. But the interview process was easy.
Interview Questions: How good is your computer skills?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions:
a responsive recruiter who helped orchestrate meetings with various people rather quickly.
The first round and second round are easily scheduled.
Open to various configurations in fitting their needs and the needs of the health system.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Student Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was with an organization recruiter perhaps as a screening tool to identify my career goals and whether the position is appropriate for me as a candidate. The follow up interview was with the unit director, though it could have been with any of three supervisors.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to complete a task that you were not trained to do.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed July 2020 so it was supposed to be a video call. The video call for whatever reason didn't work and it ended up being a phone interview with the manager and director of the unit.
Interview Questions: Specifically they will ask how you evoke their Core Values: Customer Obsessed, Relentless Improvement, Courageous Innovate, Disciplined Focus, Foster Accountability, Continuously Earn Trust

title: SFA Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward. Combination of behavioral and technical questions but the technical questions were not difficult. More of a personality gauge in my opinion.  Overall a good interview process, would not stress it too much.
Interview Questions: What is your proficiency with excel on a scale of 1-10.

title: New Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone with recruiter and asked behavioral questions and what would you do in certain situations. We went over the positions that were open and decided based on the openings.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you did something wrong and how did you fix it?

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: A telephone interview followed up by a face to face interview. Phone interview was an introduction to the job requirements and candidates relative job experience. A face to face interview was scheduled at the completion of the phone interview.
Interview Questions:
Can you multi-task and set priorities?

Are you willing to do robot training?

title: Medicals Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Very fast over the phone  process was super easy simply asked 3 questions then asked what I was looking for if I was hired . Also informed me that they help with people going to school flexo able schedule
Interview Questions: What are you interested in this position

title: EVS Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was short, straight to the point and flexible. Got there 30 min early and the manager was already there waiting. ( I thought it was nice of them to be there early just like how we are expected to be there earlier than the time scheduled).  Very professional and every question I had, was answered. The manager explained in detailed what the job consists of, and what your tasks will be during your time there.  Be prepared and ask questions. Questions that show you’re interested in the position.  Keep eye contact and don’t get distracted. The interview took place in an COVID enclosed  lobby area, where some people were walking around that was a bit distracting for me.  Questions regarding your background will be most likely asked more than questions such as “ tell me about a time when …” etc. Have set goals ( Long and short term) that includes this job or the organization.
Interview Questions: How is your previous ( manager position) position with ( Company name) help you at this job?

title: Travel RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Auto offer with submission. The agency vetted me and I was offered contract. You must fill out agency require in full and pass all required documents and tests after contract acceptance.
Interview Questions: Submission was automatic through agency

title: Staff Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward, recruiter contacts you then sets up an interview date. Afterwards you get interviewed with behavioral type questions and questions to get to know you. Very friendly and nice people from the start of the process to the end. Good luck to whoever is interviewing, you got this.
Interview Questions: Tell about yourself, tell me a time you helped a patient, tell me a time you had difficulty with a patient and what did you do to resolve the conflict

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Banner Health in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview process and actual interviewing. Straight forward and without difficulty. Receiving an offer took a while but they did eventually get it to me. Ended up declining to go with another offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us? Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Sr Treasury Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: First contact was with in-house recruiter and completion of a short interview call yo discuss the parameters of the job.  If successful then then set up zoom interview of about 45 minutes with the hiring manager .
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself and background

title: Monitor Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: A few situational questions that asked what you would do but they weren’t very difficult to answer. About 5 questions and asked if I had prior experience in that field. Overall pretty easy process
Interview Questions: What would you do if a patient was having a specific cardiac episode

title: Deputy GC Labour Law Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Met with the head of the department for a nice lunch and interview. While everything went well ultimate never heard back from them and no other commutation from anyone. Need to better communicate with candidates.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: There was none as they deny you at midnight with a generic email. Or should I say their automated program. Not willing to train just like all other companies. Wonder how college graduates are supposed to get experience if no one offers it.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Clinical Research Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant experience! First interview with Senior Manager and then a few days later with the Director. Great discussions learning about the company and position. The team had great questions for me regarding my experience and I was able to inquire what the day to day looks like with the team.
Interview Questions: Would I rather have a difficult team or a difficult manager? This was a great question!

title: PACU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Their recruiter talks with you a time or two, then sets up a time for you to do a zoom or in person interview with the department manager(s).  It’s all pretty smooth.
Interview Questions: How I handle conflict within the team

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview by phone, behavioral questions, clinical based experience, Tell me about a time you dealt with an unhappy or difficult patient or family member, How do you explain medications, treatments, or healthcare situations without using a lot of medical or healthcare jargon?
Interview Questions: Explain a situation where you got a negative feedback

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy process, they had me do a phone interview first with a recruiter for initial screening and then second interview a week later that was behavioral and personality based with a panel of managers
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had a conflict with a coworker or supervisor and what you did to resolve it?

title: PR Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Department conducts panel interviews of 6 or more people. Interview questions are behavioral type questions about past experience. "Tell us about a time where you handled a difficult customer."  or " Tell us about a time where you went above and beyond your role responsibilities"
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you handled a difficult customer.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: It lasted 30 minutes and it was ok. I got the job! I applied on a Friday, I got the email by the following Monday, and I interviewed the next day.
Interview Questions: Where would you like to work? Did you have any experience as a CNA?

title: Speech-Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a phone screening. At that time, we scheduled a phone interview with the recruiter/hiring manager. The phone interview lasted 30 minutes. There were no further interviews.
Interview Questions: Walk through the steps to evaluate and develop a treatment plan

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral interview with 3 managers: the day supervisor, evening supervisor, and the overall lab manager. They asked a lot of behavioral questions. It was somewhat challenging but they are forgiving
Interview Questions: Can’t remember, but standard behavioral questions

title: WOC Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview via phone with recruiter out of AZ. In person interview on site with clinic manager. Smooth communication with expectations clearly defined. Engaging and excited about the work that they do and the company they work for.
Interview Questions: How long are you planning on staying in this role

title: RN New Graduate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a smooth process, consisting of a conversation of interweaving about 15 questions over an hour. I felt at ease and comfortable with the interviewer and was offered a position right away. I am still interviewing at other locations and want to make the best decision before accepting/declining.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you worked with someone who treated you badly and how you dealt with it.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy and to the point. Interviewed lasted maybe less than thirty minutes.  Interviewer was kind and patient.  I believe the interview was not too hard but definitely made you think. Prepare for critical thinking questions and case studies.
Interview Questions: Q: Telemetry questions for a step down ICU position

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was called by a employee recruiting person 26 days after submitting resume. Call was comfortable no pressure at all set up an interview with department managers the next day (zoom) easy interview very down to earth. Answered any questions I had.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you had a professional problem that you were able to solve

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: It took 2 weeks for the entire process. Interview was average. I got phone interview by the recruiter and then followed by in person with hiring manager. I got an offer right away.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself. 
Behavioral and Clinical questions

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process went well, the lady I spoke with was very friendly. I submitted an application and about a week and a half later a recruiter reached out to me. Sent me an email with a link to schedule a phone appointment. I thought it was just going to be a phone call telling me about the job but we ended up going right into an interview and I was offered a job on the spot. She also got me into the unit I wanted, and it was at a location that was close to my home. 
Great experience all around.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time that you went above and beyond. 

Tell me about a time someone gave you negative feedback and then followed up with and now a time someone gave you positive feedback. 

Tell me about a time you had to learn something very quickly and how did it go. 

Tell me about a time you had to rely on a coworker to do your job and that coworker wasn't living up to the job.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was respectable and more casual than I had expected. I appreciated the interaction with the physician and recruiting team. The recruiting team was good about getting back with me on questions or concerns.
Interview Questions: Can you give us more details on your experience?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Once your application is pulled, there is first a phone call with the recruiter, then they will schedule your actual interview. Sometimes on video and sometimes it is in person.
Interview Questions: Name a time you made a mistake and how did you correct it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Chandler, AZ) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Telephone call, very personal, lots of questions and talking about my personal goals. Felt really genuine it was a little odd being on the phone and not seeing the person face to face but it was still a very good experience
Interview Questions: When was a time you went above and beyond for someone

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen with recruiter, 2nd interview with Director review resume and asking behavioral heath questions, 3rd interview with associate Director colleagues asking behavioral health questions, 4th interview with staff.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you continued to try even though others have given up.

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Yuma, AZ) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: First interview is easy and relaxed, second interview is a panel of team members asking behavioral based questions. Hard to make the interview seems as a normal conversation especially over the phone.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience as a CNA?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Banner Health in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Mainly behavioral interview questions that do not pertain to the job. Friendly, but follow-up takes a while. Benefits are adequate, but the pay is not sufficient for the level of work.
Interview Questions: Explain an experience where you had a challenging situation to overcome?

title: PCA/CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Banner Health (Denver, CO) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Had phone interview
Pleasant.went well
In person interview tomorrow 
Hope it goes well

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: - Recruiter found me via social media about a position they had tried to fill for 2 months. I took the time to apply and an initial interview with HR was setup. Received no phone call at the time/day of my scheduled interview because the assistant had scheduled it for the WRONG day. No problem. I switch my schedule around to accommodate the mistake. Finally have the interview and within 10 minutes recruiter tells me it doesn’t look like a fit because I don’t have insurance experience. Duh! How about you write a better job description that states the position needs this? or better yet, ask someone before you waste so much of their time? It felt like the recruiter was trying to meet an interview quota. I wasted my time researching and applying for the position. After this experience I wouldn’t even go to a BH location for medical care. Fortunately I found a job at a different healthcare organization.
Interview Questions: Fairly standard questions such as “How does your experience match this role?”

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Loveland, CO) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter failed to call me at our scheduled pre-screen interview time. When I reached out by email, he told me he missed our call because he had been out sick - ok, it’s common courtesy to notify an applicant ahead of time that you won’t make your scheduled interview, but I was willing to reschedule for another time. This recruiter then no-showed two more scheduled calls with no acknowledgment or apology. When he asked to reschedule the interview a third time,  I informed him I was no longer interested in a position with Banner Health. If you want to be competitive with hiring nurses in this labor market, the bare minimum you could do is treat your applicant’s time with respect.
Interview Questions: The recruiter missed three scheduled interview appointments with no notice - I did not have the opportunity to actually interview.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I was interviewed over the phone, and it was a very good experience. I was asked basic questions about previous employment, experience, and education. I was also asked a few questions about why I wanted to work for Banner, and why I thought I would be a good fit. 

The interviewer then informed me that they were interested in moving to the next step in the interview process, and that we could set up a time in the future to do that, or she could just continue on if I had time. I chose to continue on. She then asked 3 behavioral questions and asked me to use specific examples of experiences that I've had in my life in the answer. They were along the lines of 1)Tell me about a time that you made a mistake and what you did to fix it,  2)Tell me about a time when you saw that a process could be improved and the steps you took to improve the process, and 3)Tell me about a time when you had to stand up for what you thought was right.

After that she said that I sounded like a good fit for the position, and they would like to offer it to me. I asked quite a few questions that I had about the position and all it would entail, and then told her I would get back to her by the next day to let her know my answer.

She was very kind and personable, and made me feel very comfortable and at ease.
Interview Questions:
1)Tell me about a time that you made a mistake and what you did to fix it.
2)Tell me about a time when you saw that a process could be improved and the steps you took to improve the process. 
3)Tell me about a time when you had to stand up for what you thought was right.

title: Digital Product Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions:
The process from the start was great - the recruiter was super energetic and great with giving me insight on how the hiring manager would interview and what questions they would ask. 

The first interview was great with just the hiring manager. It felt informal and relaxed which was great, and the conversation flowed well. We talked about product design and Banners plans for the future with digital. 

The second interview was a panel interview with 5 other product managers. Although this was a Teams interview given the current situation, it was as good as it could be. While the recruiter set me up with info on how this interview would go, it did not play out that way at all. There were some good questions but overall I was caught off guard with how I had prepared (situational type questions).

At the end, I received the generic canned "moving on with other candidates" email. I emailed and called the recruiter twice and left a message asking for feedback but most likely will not hear back. Oh well!

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Aurora, CO) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: This was the most bizarre  experience I have had with an interview/phone screening. I initially received an email asking to fill out some basic questions of education and how many years of experience I had in different areas (ie: sql, excel, etc) and then was asked to send over my availability. I then scheduled a call with a recruiter for the next day. She was nice but instead of the typical phone screenings I have had in the past of asking me to tell her about my experience and background, she re-asked me the questions in the email, with somewhat awkward silence in between each question. She then went on letting me know she is inputting my info in their 'calculating system' which will better identify the salary expectations for my experience and how it aligns with this role.  Are we seriously at an age where we are now using tools to give a rough estimate of how much you think someone is worth? And without even asking a high level overview of their background? She never once even told me any information about the position or the team itself. If this interview process at Banner Health is a standard process, and you plug in years of technical experience into a tool to give you an estimate of how much you're willing to pay someone, I personally want nothing to do with an organization with such a flawed system. Companies should 1.) provide the potential candidate a chance to give some sort of background/ experience 2.) look at someone's potential and include that as a factor. I also gave this information initially in my email when I was first contacted so not sure why I had to re-iterate my information, wasting mine and the recruiters time. My education apparently also had a factor in the process. We are living in 2020 and I graduated college 6 years ago. A lot of people have a degree in something completely unrelated to what they are doing now. Why wouldn't a company look at direct experience opposed to a college degree? It wasn't even for a clinical position? Again, such a bizarre experience and after that, would not even want to work for an organization who operates that way.
Interview Questions: What is your highest level of education? What was your degree in?
