title: Senior Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Banner Health (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: They reached out two times with 4 months in between. Both times they said we are going to fill this position very fast. Both times no response . I believe they are Indecisive.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions. I was the perfect match

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Fallon, NV) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Incredibly awkward. I get with Covid,  companies doing interviews by Skype. The two I interviewed with never turned their camera on so I only saw myself on my screen  I never knew where to look or be able to make eye contact.  It made for a really weird interview.
Interview Questions: What's one thing you have done wrong and how did you learn from it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Chandler, AZ) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Was Skype interview. Took two weeks from time I spoke with the recruiter. First a recruiter calls then sets up a interview with hiring team.   Fairly simple process.
Interview Questions: Name a time you went above and beyond for a pt?

title: CyberSecurity Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email invite less than two weeks later. Arranged a phone call with a recruiter to discuss general skills. Scheduled a 2nd interview with the hiring manager. He discussed the organization and situation, then asked behavioral questions, nothing technical. I felt the interview went well. I was told the next step was filling out a form and getting it to HR, I should hear something "mid next week".  Weeks, then months passed. They completely ghosted me. I felt disrespected.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond, what was the positive result personally and organizationally.

title: Infection Preventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Worst interview experience ever! The questions were all behavioral, multi-part questions, and all focused on leading teams or people. This was an entry level position. Difficult to connect with interviewer. She asked the questions and there was silence after responses, with no acknowledgement, conversation, etc.
Interview Questions: Tell me about  a time...

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing and hiring process was stress free and  easy. Everyone I spoke and interacted with throughout the process was friendly, competent, efficient and a true pleasure to work with. I applied online and received an email to schedule a phone screening interview with a recruiter which was done in 2 days, I was then offered a Skype interview with members of the hiring team.   I completed this interview the next day and was offered a position the following week.
Interview Questions: The interview consisted of some behavioral based questions and open dialogue with members of the OR.

title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Fair; respectful; prompt after application; Ghe process started with a recruiter, which forward my application on to the hiring manager of the department I was interested in. Within a few days, I had an interview and was hired
Interview Questions: Tell me about your last experiences at work

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screen and phone interview on the same day. It was with a new grad recruiter who asked me about me as a whole and how my values align with Banner’s values.
Interview Questions: When have you showed a time to be customer obsessed?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter was very friendly and professional. We spoke on the phone twice. I first call was a phone screening that reviewed my resume, application, and work preferences. The second call was a phone interview because I was an out of state applicant. I was offered a position at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you went above and beyond.

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: I was first was contacted by a recruiter to schedule an interview the following week. Didn't hear back from the manager for a month afterward, but I got the job. I started about 3 weeks after that.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you went above and beyond in customer service.

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Aurora, CO) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: After a phone interview, the company ghosted me very rudely. I applied for two positions on the website as they instructed, and a company recruiter contacted me by e-mail  for one of them. During the initial screening  interview with the recruiter, she said she thought I would be a good candidate for both positions, and would forward my resume to the recruiter for the other position. I had a phone interview with the hiring manager for this first position, and I thought it went well. I never got any  feedback or further contact, not even an e-mail saying "Thanks, but no thanks."  I reached out by e-mail to the recruiter, but never got a response. I went on the website and saw that both my applications were marked "No Longer Under Consideration."  I reached out to the recruiter again by phone just to ask for feedback on what were my weak areas such that I was not being considered, and/or for feedback on how to improve my interview performance. Again, no response. I don't think I would want to work for an organization that treats its potential employees so rudely. I  am a highly qualified and experienced professional, I met the qualification requirements for both positions, and I kind of expect to be treated with good manners and professionalism during the recruiting process. They are still advertising for at least one of the positions.
Interview Questions: What was my background and experience with the program area that I would be working in

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Hired over phone interview. They are not picky. You got experience? They will hire you. Interview person do not give you much info about the job. Make sure to think & write down a bunch of questions to ask and consider the offer. Money isn't much.
Interview Questions: Give me one example when you stood up for a patient.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview brief about expectations of the candidate and the program. Asked for reference letters and assigned follow up interview date and time. Total of about 15 minutes for the phone interview.
Interview Questions: What unit are you interested in working in?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: I had a Phone interview with a recruiter, Invited for an in person interview with the Senior Manager of the floor, job offer after a few days from interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had conflict with a coworker?

title: Nursing Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: First you will receive an initial email to schedule a phone call, then you will have a 20 minute phone call with a Banner recruiter. I didn’t hear back until I called them with the status of my application.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Business Performance Analyst SQL Programming Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process was pretty standard. I submitted an application online. Then I had a phone interview with HR. Next I had a video interview (because of COVID 19) with the hiring manager and one team member. Lastly I received an offer from Banner Health.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when a project was not proceeding as planned.

title: HIMS Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Sun City, AZ) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly relaxed but included quite a few behavioral questions, that were fairly difficult to answer. The hiring manager did a great job at keeping the interview relaxed, which helped to ease the nerves.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you lost someone's trust, and what did you do to earn their trust back.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: via phone call and zoom, was interviewed by the recruiter first and she set up a meeting with one of the managers. Was asked scenario-based questions. Everyone was very nice and encouraging and eager to listen.
Interview Questions: "When was a time you went above and beyond to help a patient"

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening interview, all the onboarding paperwork and tasks have to be completed before you start so it's a drain on current employer. Then there are 2 in person interviews.
Interview Questions: What do you do for fun outside of work?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: My interview went very well.  My manager and I hit it off right away. She as very open about the staff there.  She explained the culture of the department, the variety of sub-specialties and the challenges in the role.
Interview Questions: Too varied to mention

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen followed by an in person interview with behavioral health questions. The questions were related to the banner values. I received a call within 24 hours and had 24 hours to accept the position
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Patient Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone call with recruiter. Asked general questions like where do you see yourself in 5 years and why did you apply. Went over job description. Scheduled in person interview right after phone interview.
Interview Questions: General questions like where do you see yourself in 5 years and why did you apply.

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with two people. It lasted about 15 minutes and one of them gave me a short tour afterwards. They asked me about my education and then 5 behavioral questions. I made sure to bring two updated copies of my resume and dressed professionally. They warned me about seeing some graphic things while on the job and that I will be delivering deceased patients to the morgue.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you gave excellent customer service.

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Banner Health in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: no no non non hard panel with no direction of questions manage left to answer the phone came back said his child need him left an left his staff in charge worst ever
Interview Questions: basic interview questions was asked

title: Placement Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: First was a phone screen with the recruiter, once that was completed the recruiter set up an in person meeting with the supervisor a week later. This in person interview was 100% behavior-based questions.  The hiring manager was friendly and honest about the position. I was able to meet the team that was currently working and understand what it would be like to work there.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you didn't make a patient happy.

title: New Graduate RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was an application online, followed by a call from a new grad recruiter and a phone interview.  After speaking with the recruiter and telling her my interest in units we scheduled an completed a single one-on-one interview
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to go against something that most people were following or wanting to do

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well, standard questions you would expect. The interviewer was the hiring manager and reviewed my LinkedIn prior to the interview. The conversation seemed to go well. They told me the hours and typical behavior that everyone leaves by 2-3 p.m. to beat traffic and finishes their day at home. I did not receive a call back, no thanks email, or any feedback. Guess I didn't fit the bill.
Interview Questions: Standard HR fare - background, experience, tell me about a time when, etc.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty straight forward. Nothing out of the blue. One tip, they place particular attention to appearance such as how you dress and your personal hygiene. They are mainly concerned on your attitude towards the job than your experience which is not particularly a bad thing; anything can be achieved with the right mind set, but you'll not get far with the wrong attitude.
Interview Questions: Should you draw from a person who has had a vasectomy??

title: Patient Financial Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: There was a group interview with about 10 interviewers in the room, they went around the table asking questions.  Questions pertained to my experience level and knowledge of insurance, billing and appeals.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Health Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, in person interview with several people, behavioral questions, if you really want the position you need to prepare, look for expected questions since is a panel interview can be intimidated if you are not prepared
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you went above and beyond for a patient

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Didn't receive a response until 2 months after I applied. I got an email asking me to schedule a phone interview, which was super casual and consisted of making sure what I wanted aligned with what Banner was offering in terms of pay and available positions. I am an ADN, so she wanted to ensure that I was enrolled or at least planning on pursuing my Bachelor's degree (which I am). Then we scheduled an in person interview for the week after. They asked a bunch of behavioral type questions. I was offered a position on the spot. My first day for on boarding was two weeks after the interview, and training starts the week after that.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you received criticism and how you responded

title: Product Owner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Disappointing, low technical skill on team. Didn't ask the right questions to measure if I was a good fit. But that's not unique to this enterprise. You can pretty much expect that for any non-tech company.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Easy communication and stress free, interviewer was very easy to talk to and was very nice. Worked with me and where I wanted to go. Asked for top 3 choices and units and discussed best possible choices were available
Interview Questions: Greatest strength

title: Banner Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Denver, CO) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Banner uses behavioral interview questions during the interview process. You will receive an email or call to set up a phone interview to see why you would like to work for Banner, then an in person interview with hiring manager.
Interview Questions:
*Tell me about a time that you dealt with a difficult situation.
*Tell me about a time you made a mistake.
*Tell me about a time you went above and beyond.

title: Workforce Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Extremely professional interview process. Quick and efficient. I spoke with HR, then the hiring manager, then a panel interview. Although I didn't receive an offer everyone was nice, professional and very open
Interview Questions: STAR based questions... the standard tell me about a time when

title: IT Security Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews; 1 with HR, 1 phone interview with HM and one with the team, which is the last one and now waiting to hear if there will be an offer
Interview Questions: How I would handle a difficult situation with another team member or customer/stakeholder?

title: PFS Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Greeley, CO)
Interview Descriptions: While you sit in a room, each manager or supervisor will ask you a question related to your experience or scenario.  The hiring staff also did small talk and explained the position.  What happened is a manager from each department interviews you and them after they decide which team you would make a good fit.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a situation were the customer was angry.  How did you handle the situation?

title: Surgery Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview,  at least 1 manager and 2-3 employees. Have well thought-out and detailed answers.  From application time, to recruiter contacting you and getting an interview, it takes a very long time, sometimes 6 weeks
Interview Questions: Based on Banner Core Values, ( Foster Accountability, Courageously Innovate, Disciplined Focus, Continuously Earn Trust, Customer Obsessed, Relentless Improvement)

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter was super nice, asked 5 questions that aligned w/ Banner's mission. It was really quick, maybe 15 min, and I have no idea how it went.  I still have not heard back.
Interview Questions: -	Name a time that something didn't go the way you expected it to and what did you do to change it.

title: House Staff Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: You submit your CV and  letters. They call you in for an interview. You meet the faculty. They take you to lunch. You may get the offer on the spot or find out later depending on the situation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a -ologist? Why here?

title: Senior IT Auditor (Consult Inf Tech) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Basic question about my experience. Perform IT audit from start to finish according to IIA audit processes and IT risk and control using frameworks such as (example, COSO, CoBIT, ISO, NIST, PCI DSS
Interview Questions: Auditing process

title: LNA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: A contact from the recruitment team is given to see if you are interested in position and if so a phone interview is set up.  If all is well you are to follow up by a in person interview if you fit the qualifications.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a complicated family member.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: I think it was straight forward.  The interviewer asked 8 questions that all new grads are asked.  They were all behavioral, but they were pretty easy to answer.
Interview Questions: What was a process that you had to change, how did that change work?

title: General Surgeon Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was 1st interviewed by video which was very informative and did not require travel before I was sure about the possibility. I also was given a second in person interview where I learned a great deal about the health system.
Interview Questions: I was asked how I can improve processes with limited resources.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: was interviewed by the floor manager and a bedside nurse. I was asked a series of questions that would give them an idea of how I would handle various situations in the intensive care unit
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: A few behavioral based questions.  Not much feedback. The interview was not personal at all. I feel that they cannot base employment off of a few basic behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a conflict with an employee

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: they asked 6 questions relating to their values. keep it short and specific to that value. the interview went quick. dressed business casual. given a tour of the facility. showed the unit I'd be working on .
Interview Questions: they all related to the companies values.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Houston, TX) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: it was pretty basic, basic questions, group interview instead of one on one. long as you know how to talk about yourself and your experience, you got it. Asked about the experience, hypothetical scenarios, etc.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a stressful situation?

title: Inventory Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Banner Health (Fort Morgan, CO) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a short, over the phone interview. They asked my background with knowing inventory, my work history and what my expect salary was. This interview took about 20 minutes and then I was immediately offered the position.
Interview Questions: What is your background in Inventory?

title: PPA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a short interview but good. The we're very friendly and put me at easy. It was one of the best interviews I have had in a long time
Interview Questions: About what did in last job

title: Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: My one-on-one interview was with the Clinical Nutrition Manager. All questions asked during the interview were behavior based questions, mostly about my past experiences. No clinical nutrition questions were asked.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you went above and beyond what was asked of you.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very quick, I would say from just a few days from submission of application to receiving an invite for interview. Then perhaps one week from interview to acceptance offer. The overall interview was not too lengthy. Folks at the Corporate office were pleasant enough.
Interview Questions: Know your "behavioral interview" questions, for example: "Describe a difficult situation with a co-worker and how you handled it".

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, then an in person interview with various questions about clinical and previous work experience. Asked what culture we preferred. I wanted new grads so that was great. Was offered a job and happily accepted even though I would perfer better pay
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you received some criticism from a nursing instructor.

title: Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, 2 to 3 days later recieved an email for a phone interview.  Set up a time for the interview and did not get a call. I called the number provided within the email. She returned my call. She yawned and had an attitude during the interview.
Interview Questions: What makes you a great candidate for the job

title: Healthcare Schedule Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for a phone interview on 2/27/19.  This was via email.  I was invited to schedule an interview between the dates of 3/1/19-3/6/19. I scheduled my interview for  3/5/19 at 11 am.     I received a confirmation of my scheduled interview with the confirmation number.  I also received a reminder a day before my scheduled interview.    Needless to say... I took time out of my schedule for the interview and no one called.   I went on line to verify that i correctly noted my contact number and it was correct.   I went and checked to status of my application and it stated that I was longer being considered as of 3/4/19, which was the day before my scheduled interview.  No one called to cancel or notified me of the cancellation.  This was extremely frustrating and shows lack of professionalism and communication.
Interview Questions: Give 2 examples of internal and external customer service.

title: Dosimetrist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straight forward and focused on technical aspects of the position. There were three levels of interviews including individual and group panels. Overall standard process for this line of work.
Interview Questions: How could you decrease depth of dose?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Situation, action, results are the question set up. Six questions based upon Banner values . May take awhile to get interview follow up. Will likely need to negotiate higher pay.
Interview Questions: How did you handle adversity

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: First I received a phone call from a recruiter, she explained the program and then asked me what my preference for location, shift, and unit.  We scheduled a face to face interview.  The interview itself was very brief. I think I was in there for about 20 min. The recruiter went over the same thing that we discussed on the phone and then 5 behavioral style questions 2 specifically from clinical experience and 3 from any experiences I have had overall.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you received constructive criticism

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter called me and we discussed my qualifications. He then described the position for which they were advertising. He gave me a range of hourly wages. Within a few days, I was offered the position that I accepted.
Interview Questions: Tell me why you feel you would be a good fit for this position.

title: MA Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Through with multiple behavioral situation questions. Manager was very professional and seemed very busy as they over saw multiple clinics in the Phoenix area. Didn't really like schedule they offrrrd: always at a different clinic and could change from day to day. Pay is on way lower end for an experienced M.A.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation that you went above and beyond for a patient?

title: Patient Financial Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Did a phone interview with a recruiter, was selected to interview in person. Met with a few pfs supervisors they asked behavioral based questions. It was a pretty simple interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation tell what where and why

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was called first by a recruiter and after about 10 minutes of a phone conversation, she offered me to come for an interview. The in-person interview was not hard but I had to prepare for it and the recruiter was sweet and personable.
Interview Questions: Tell me the time when you went above and beyond.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview just screening. second interview was with colleagues that you would work with. Final interview was with the project owners. The two in person interviews were with 3 people
Interview Questions: They have several standard questions then some situational questions

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: First applied online, and within a week was called to schedule an email.  We set up a schedule time for the interview. All questions were based on behaviors and focused on serving patients. Over all the process was great.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for your patient

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview Process was more of a general Behavioral HR interview than an IT Interview, no questions on my IT skills other a brief look over what I presented on my resume. The process was 1 ) Phone Screen 2 ) In Person 3  ) Offer
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to work on a group project and someone else was not doing what they were supposed to. How did you handle that situation?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quick turn around.  Easy interview.  Called and scheduled within a week.  Was offered the job before I reached the parking lot.  Drug screening was required within 3 days of accepting the offer.  The background check took forever, and they required tax returns for the past 10 years because I was self employed and needed to prove I wasn't lying about being self employed.   The background checkers did not answer their phones when references tried to return phone calls.
Interview Questions: General get to know you questions.

title: Human Resource Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Glendale, AZ) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter was very knowledgeable about the role I was applying for and was quick to respond with an offer after the interview.   She kept me informed during the interview process and was very professional.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous experience?

title: Undergrad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly good. the initial was hard because i thought it was a phone interview the way they described it but it wasnt.  I enjoyed the interview it was basic questions you usually get asked. so fairly easy. but the whole process was a little complicated.
Interview Questions: weakness

title: Business Performance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews, one on line and one in person. The one on the phone was with 3/4 people and the one in person was with the director and 2 senior data scientist. The one on the phone was more difficult because they drilled down on more specific skills as far as SQL knowledge and statistical analysis
Interview Questions: solve a medical analytical case, or at least show the process from which you would start the analysis

title: Monitor Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: First contacted by phone. After a few questions moved to a in-person interview. Was first showed what I would be doing as a monitor tech before I met the hiring manager. Went over what I saw and asked their behavioral questions. Next I would have to take a EKG test and pass with at least a 85%.
Interview Questions: Name a time you stood up for something you believed in?

title: Catering Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with Sarah and she explained the position and the company structure and departments. She then asked me a serious of questions about by work history.  The interview was about an hour long.
Interview Questions: She asked me when I turned a negative experience into a positive experience.

title: Staff Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quick and concise. Applied for a position on Sunday and was offered a phone interview on Monday. Website was very easy to navigate through and was able to choose from a variety of times and dates to schedule the interview.
Interview Questions: What makes you interested in working for Banner Health

title: Culinary Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy. Have the decency to follow up with candidates in a timely manner. I understand companies wanting to find the right fit but in no way should the process take over a month.
Interview Questions: Typical behavioral type questions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral based questions, managers taking notes, annoying questions such as "tell me a time when..." panel interview, 3 or more managers present.  I interviewed more than once with Banner, some more formal than others.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you implemented a process that brought about change in your organization.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Greeley, CO) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview of 3 people. Each asked me predefined questions that were on a printed out sheet. They took notes of my responses. I was able to ask multiple questions about benefits and about what the process was going to be for my hire. Only down side is they make you work full time for training, even if you get hired on part time.
Interview Questions: Describe your work experience

title: BHT Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: After applying it took several weeks before I heard about the interview process. At that point though the process moved smooth and quick. Had an initial phone screen and then an in person interview with one manager later that week. The interview took approx 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when did not agree with a supervisor.

title: RN HOME CARE Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview was professional  and. friendly, looking for a good employer/employee fit. Enthusiastic managers present job honestly and provided clear expectations. Good information regarding benefits. Excellent recruiter assistance as well. Good orientation process.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where something you suggested was initiated

title: RN Float Pool Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Recruiter was difficult to get back in touch with. If they call, make sure you set-up an interview asap! Short 1:1 interview with behavioral type questions. Very laid back environment.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you went above and beyond.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Queen Creek, AZ) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had a 30 minute phone screen to go over experience, educations, skills. Was scheduled the next day for an hour Skype call with 3 women (supervisors, managers) to further discuss the position, location, office culture, and answer 5 behavioral questions. They really are looking for a calm and collected individual that can be a quick thinker and keep the patient calm, comfortable, and happy. Don't sell yourself short, make sure to be very confident. Relax, be yourself, friendly, joke a little when and where appropriate. They want a team player who can get along well with the others.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you went above and beyond

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received interview invitation from HR, then phone interview with the manager. Didnt ask a lot of questions but regarding Banner values. The process took about a week
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position,

title: Business Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and then received an email to set up a time to talk on the phone.  Over the phone, they explained the job more in detail, and we set up a time to meet in person and do an interview.
Interview Questions: Mostly questions about past experience, and also about how you handled situations in your previous employment. Pretty basic interview questions.  Asked how you have handled change in your former workplace.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the  New Grad RN west valley locations online and my application would not move into "review" until I called the hiring managers three times. I was set up with an interview the following week. The interview itself went well, with a lot of behavioral questions and the hiring manager was very nice. The interview did feel a little rushed and lacked questions on patient care. I was offered a position for nights an hour and a half from where I live. There was no other offer although there are a number of Banner hospitals around the area. I declined the offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had a difficult patient, how did you handle the situation and what was the outcome?

title: Dietary Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone interview with two of the managers. Asked a variety of behavioral and situational questions. Was not a difficult interview and they were very friendly and repeated questions when I asked. Phone did cut out at times during the interview.
Interview Questions: Have you ever disagreed with a supervisor? Why and what di you do?

title: Pharmacy Patient Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The people who interviewed me were not professional and didn’t seem to take the interview seriously. The recruiter was slow to respond and it took well over a month and several emails just to find out that I didn’t get the job. I’m almost happy they didn’t offer me based on their interview/hiring process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you left a customer unhappy

title: RN Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Multiple levels of behavioral based questions designed to assess how compatible the candidate is with the companies core values. Questions are very similar, but worded differently. Almost feels like they are trying to confuse you. Listen to the questions carefully and answer the questions as simply as possible.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a time when you had to deal with a difficult person. How did you handle the situation and what was the outcome.

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with five team members taking turns asking questions from however many sheets of paper. The interview took long because each person where writing on their sheets taking notes of my answers.
Interview Questions: Behavioral

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Completed a questionnaire online, then got an email a day after from a recruiter to set up a day and time for a phone interview. It took about 20 minutes, she asked me about my interest in Banner and briefly went over the position. She then set up a day and time for an in person interview. It was supposed to be a panel interview, however it ended up being just one of the RN managers. She was very nice and made the interview go smoothly and made me feel very comfortable. The interview took an hour, I was asked 6 questions all of which were behavioral based. I was told I’d get a call from my recruiter in a couple days on the status of my application. Received a call 3 days later and was told Banner was not going to extend an offer due to the days I told them I needed off for a vacation that was planned months ago. Another recruiter ended up calling me and I have another interview set for a CNA position at another Banner location.

title: Pharmacy Technician CPhT Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were very nice and easy to talk to you. Panel interview with two supervisors and one technician. Lasted about 30 minutes. Received a call the next day. HR process was very smooth.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to deal with a difficult customer and how you handled it.

title: New Grad RN Interview

HR rep then told me that she would like to set a panel interview up (via phone since I live out-of-state) and we choose a date the next week.

title: Employee Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: They had zero regard for my time, they were late to all interviews. It got rescheduled and communication was very poor. All involved were not on the same page.  I would not recommend this company... the interview was a preview of what its like to work there.
Interview Questions: They have a list of set behavioral questions.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ)

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2018

Interview Questions: N/A

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Feb 2018

Interview Questions: What is one thing you are passionate about in nursing?

title: Network Support Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Scottsdale, AZ) in Feb 2018

title: IT Software Engineer Interview

From application to offer was approximately 2 months.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: Applied online via Banner Health website. Took a personality test online. Received a call from a recruiter. Scheduled in person interview.  Interviewed with a management panel. Mostly experience, scenario, and behavioral type questions.
Interview Questions: Share a time you had conflict with a coworker and what you did to resolve it.

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and fast, they first do a couple phone interviews before they move you on to an in-person interview. The in-person interview was very relaxed they walked me through the hospital and showed me around.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The entire interview process was very very unprofessional and I had a harrowing experience. This organization projects itself as a leader in the industry, but from I experience they were extremely unprofessional. I was offered the role, made to wait for 6 weeks for the offer letter and then they rescinded the offer.

The interview process took one week - Started with a phone screen, one phone call with the Director and then a panel interview via Skype. The questions were standard behavioral interview questions, which can found on the internet. I was offered the role the very next day and accepted it. The Recruiter said he would get back to me after the necessary approvals.

Then the waiting game began. Emails and phone calls go unanswered. Even if you leave repeated voicemails, they do not get answered. I was given neither any update nor any timeline, even after I repeatedly asked for one. I became extremely frustrated after waiting for 5+ weeks for the offer letter and dropped an email to the Hiring Manager. They then got back to me saying they cannot offer the role due to costs for visa sponsorship. I was extremely dissappointed as this point was discussed during my initial screening and it did not seem to be a problem.

Banner Health must realise that candidates do not like to be seen as just a number or a doormat. They would value your organization more if you value them for their skills. I would advise candidates (especially international students on F1/OPT/H1B visas) to be highly cautious when applying here.
Interview Questions: 3 Weaknesses and Strengths?

title: Administrative Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions:
3 rounds interview including the final round were all conducted over Skype or phone.  During one of the interviews, the recruiter on the other end did not even turn on web camera, I was the only one on the line that dressed professionally and turned on web cam. This was quite strange, given that they reminded me to dress properly for Skype interview in previous email. 

The managerial people I interviewed with are professional and nice. However the entire process seems like they wanted to know everything about me, while not allowing enough time for me to ask question.  Even when I do get chance to ask questions about culture and organization, I get very generic answers.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you went above and beyond to help a client/consumer.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted first by a recruiter in HR.  She then set up an interview with manager, I was given a tour of the unit, and allowed to ask any questions I had. I then followed up with a second group interview with some of the current staff, and they would give me scenario like questions to answer as well.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a difficult patient, and how you handled the situation.

title: Patient Financial Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Loveland, CO) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had received a phone call about a week after applying to 3 different opportunities for an interview in their Loveland, CO location. I lived in IL during that time so they were prepared to interview over the phone and through skype but I was headed  that direction for the Thanksgiving holidays so I was able to interview in person. The first interview was with their Family Clinic. I really enjoyed the manager and how they are all about team work and patient focused. However I wasn't going to be in the area until after Christmas of 2017 and the manager really needed someone immediately. She did press on to the HR rep, who was amazing, that she really liked me and wanted to hire me on the spot. It was just unfortunate that I was unable to start immediately. I recently had another interview with a different department and I am still waiting on the managers to come up with a decision.
Interview Questions: How well do you work with other co workers?

title: Clinical Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview of intimidating management members. Horrific experience not once but both times I applied here. Disappointing experience, as I believed I would be a wonderful asset to this employer but the management seems less than accommodating to my hire.
Interview Questions: All pre-determined behavioral based and asked without inflection or intonation.

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I put in an application for the labor and delivery unit. I was called a week or so after.  They went over hours, job description and if that would work for me and then set up a time for an interview. I interviewed with two managers from the unit they had 12 questions to choose from and asked me six. They were all behavioral based and they don't ask much about you personally so I had to describe my qualities and skills through my answers as well. I got a call back within the next 2 days.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where someone didn't hold up their load of work and how you had to handle that.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Greeley, CO)
Interview Descriptions:
I was given a phone interview with a recruiter, I was asked why Banner Health and why I chose nursing. Then after this interview she connected me with three different hiring managers from areas that were currently seeking RNs. I was interviewed over the phone by three people. And asked behavioral questions such as, explain a time when you had to change a plan of care in order to establish the original goal? 
I was called back and offered two positions to choose from within 24hrs, it was very nice to have such a rapid response.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you went above and beyond

title: Medical Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed one on one with manager of department asked about my education, certification through AAPC, my experience, my work ethic,  was I dependable, reliable, was I able to work along side  co workers, was I willing to be trained to code multi specialties within the department.
Interview Questions: coding experience

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was in person, easy going, about 6-8 questions with a recruiter. As a new grad, the questions were behavioral type questions and asked for examples from RN school & clinical experience. The interview felt rushed since it was the end of the day, and I was not certain if it went well or not, but I think the recruiter was just tired from interviews. I did get a call back.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you received some criticism from a nursing instructor.

title: Operations Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Greeley, CO)
Interview Descriptions: The process began with an online application that included personality / behavioral survey questions. The online application is detailed and lengthy. It does allow for import of a resume which requires further cleanup to correct items not picked up in the resume import. Telephone Interview followed by in person panel interview
Interview Questions: Think of a time that you were responsible for a project that did not go as planned.  Describe the project and what went wrong. What did you learn from that experience

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions:
I recently applied to a position at Banner Health. Overall, I did not enjoy the application process, so much so that I am writing this message.

At the end of the application, there is a questionnaire. Many of the questions were either unclear or weren't applicable to the job I applyied for. It was not an enjoyable process feeling like I may be screened out simply because:
1) There wasn't a suitable answer to a given quesiton.
2) The question was too ambiguous.
3) I had to guess an answer because the question wasn't applicable to me.

I came out of the application process feeling like I wasted my time answering so many generic questions (there were ~100 questions). If you need to screen out candidates, please don't make me feel like I'm wasting my time in order for you to do so; it doesn't matter what reasons you have for having each of these questions.

In answering the questionnaire, I accidentally marked a question wrongly and was unable to go back to correct it. I would have no problem with a system that doesn't allow for correction if it wasn't such a long questionnaire.

One of the last questions asks me to explain why I am the best person for this job. Please don't ask my why I am the best person for this job; I don't know the other candidates; I don't know the work culture or the specific tasks. If for some reason you still think this is a good idea to ask this question, please don't only give me 100 characters to make my case.

I know working at Banner Health will be a different experience than the application process, but the application process is the first real glimpse of company culture that applicants get. Utilize that time to show off the culture; do not squander that opportunity by making the application feel dehumanized.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best person for this job?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the new grad experience program and was scheduled for an interview three weeks later with a recruiter. Recruiter went over the program then asked behavior style interview questions. I asked a few questions at the end and was offered a position on the spot.

Typical interview, with typical questions

title: RN Clinical Research Specialist Interview

After waiting for 3 weeks after my last interview I received feedback that they would have loved to hire me but that I lacked the experience they were searching for and that perhaps in the future there would be more opportunity.  I was disappointed since they knew about my experience from the start and I thought that wasn't an issue but I guess it was.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
