title: Business Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was scheduled timely, it was Brief yet thorough thoughtful and informative. Panel was welcoming and knowledgeable. Job Overview lasted just about 30 mins and then Q&A time  to address any additional questions or concerns. Ended with a thank you and a hand shake and response time re hiring decision was within 2weeks
Interview Questions: Greatest asset

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and did a personality quiz the same day, received an email one day later for confirmation of a phone interview and did the phone interview the morning afterwards. During phone interview made an appointment for a person interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a situation that you felt stressed/pressured? Easy questions if you do your research.

title: HUC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Got a phone interview. In person interview (2 people) Follow up call 3 days later with offer for hire. Start work in 30 days after all pre employment testing is done..
Interview Questions: How have you gone above and beyond?

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Multiple layer processes, processes not consistent despite internal transfer and recruitment,  role and responsibilities not well defined.  HR is cumbersome and recruiters seem driven for wrong reasons.  Care delivery departments do a far better job, if they are presented with candidates.
Interview Questions: Formalized process

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: phone interview was solid, however the actual interview process was very very lengthy and poorly organized. many of the people i was to interview did not make it and I had flown in on a early flight from the east coast. the whole process was 6 hours, many times sitting in a conference room for 1/2hr to 1hr at a time. was not impressed to say the least. i guess i anticipated more for a provider position
Interview Questions: describe a time you went above and beyond the call of duty for your job?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: You have a phone interview with the recruiter then they schedule you for an in-person interview which asks about 8 to 11 behavioral questions. For example "Tell me a time where this happened to you and what you did and what was the outcome. It's fairly easy.  Usually with a panel interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you dealt with an angry patient or customer. what did you do? what was the outcome?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Banner Health (Peoria, AZ) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
behavior questions , with stars method. Most difficult customer deal with. Conflict . The 3 s E energetic enthusiasm empowering . Thanks Share your interview experience insights with job seekers so that they can know what to expect from the hiring process.

We review and approve every submission against our Community Guidelines before it is published to the site.
Interview Questions: What do you like least

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Online application reviewed by HR before hiring mgr on the floor sees it.  Computer will automatically review application, so if you clicked "no" and they were looking for a "yes" the application won't go any further.  If you pass this step, HR will contact by phone to ask basic questions about your transportation, where in the hospital the job is, etc., and appointment is made with the hiring manager.  One on one, or panel interview will provide scenarios on how you would respond.
Interview Questions: Give me an example when you went above and beyond and provided excellent nursing care.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: You have one phone meeting with HR and then an in person (this was before covid) meeting with 2 team leaders. Pretty relaxed and a few technical questions that are easy. Easy process.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself. What order to you complete hard and easy tasks.

title: Environmental Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: You must park in a specific parking structure and check in with security before going to the other Banner building. The first interview was in person with the department manager and HR manager. The questions were related to my experience and the regulations they follow in Arizona. There was also specific Banner questions that must be asked to every potential candidate regardless of job title (my assumption). Those questions were strangely worded and difficult to answer. I asked for clarification on one of them and the interviewers could not give clarification.  There was a follow up interview with others in the department as well as a regional EHS director as well as the initial HR manager and EHS manager who performed the first interview. Some others were teleconferenced in. The questions were more or less along the same lines as before with more specifics on my past experience. Ultimately, they went with another, more experience candidate. The interview process was pleasant and succinct.
Interview Questions: Regulatory related questions. Asked about experience in certain DEQ or EPA programs

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy, typical interview process for an RN. Have references available, make sure license is up to date and active. Must take drug test. Applied on-line, got a phone call shortly after. Overall an easy experience.
Interview Questions: What is your experience? How do you deal with difficult situations or people?

title: Labor and Delivery RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: met with management during the 1st interview.  asked ~5 questions and toured the unit.  I was called back for a second interview.  This interview had 1 manager and 3 peers.  They asked similar question.
Interview Questions: describe a time when you went above and beyond your job descritption

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Quick 15 minute interview with supervisor after an initial phone interview with HR. overall easy and mainly a description of the job with few real questions about myself. Best way to prepare is research the position and be prepared to answer questions on a patient care technicians role
Interview Questions: Scenario questions pertaining to job

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: First I was contacted by a recruiter, and a brief telephone interview; then I was scheduled for an interview with the department hiring manager. The interview was very relaxed, and was followed by a tour. I was offered the position the next day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your most interesting patient, and why they were interesting.

title: Practice Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: They first had their HR/Talent Requisition people call and speak to me to screen my skills.  Then they arrange for an interview.  The interview is with a panel of people, 2 Directors, and 3 or 4 Practice Administrators, and then an HR person.  It's pretty intimidating at first, but you just do it.
Interview Questions: They are big on asking scenario questions.  What would you do if.... or how would you handle x.

title: PCA - Med/Surg ICU Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was very comfortable through out the interview. Be sure to bring copies of your resume, because the interviewer didn't have mine on hand so I was able to provide her with one. I also got a tour of the floor and was introduced to some of the staff. It took a total of 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Some questions were: why do you think you would be a good addition to the team? Why are your strengths? Describe a time where you had to change a patients care plan and why? Describe a time where you had to deal with a conflict with another employee and what happened?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Lots of behavioral questions, interviewer was not dressed very professional. But they acted very professional.They will also ask about your skills and how you would rate them. The interviewer was very kind and they will also need to phone screen you as well before hand. The process is automated so when you submit your resume make sure the answer the questions, the process will screen you out if you don't fit the criteria.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you disagreed with a manager and what was the outcome?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received a phone call for an interview appointment, via recruiter. Interviewed with only recruiter a couple days later- mostly behavioral questions. I was offered the position on the spot.
Interview Questions: What are 3 ways you would promote or bring teamwork to your unit?

title: Patient Financial Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The job was located in Tucson, Arizona their corporate recruiting team is located in Phoenix, Arizona so the interview was via Skype. They lady was very nice asked 5 typical interview questions. Offered me the job immediately after interview.
Interview Questions: What's your greatest weakness?

title: Contracts Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: 2 days, no agenda, no list of questions on either side and 6-8 people randomly coming into conference room asking sometimes un-related questions of the role. Scattered and unorganized at best. Left me feeling very uncomfortable with department and how it was run and the hiring manager sat through the entire process without interjecting any guidance to anyone, except one time and that was not nearly enough. Maybe this "test" was the point of this chaotic process? Doubtful, I think they operate this way and I am glad I avoided it entirely with no offer. Huge RED FLAG.
Interview Questions: How my previous job experience related to the role

title: New Patient Experience Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter call, in person interview.  The interviewer was late, made negative comments about her work, and at the end used an offensive microaggression statement.  I was told I would get a call from the interview about the position.  I received an email from the recruiter stating that the position had been closed and no one was hired because they needed to "rethink" the position.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to apply for this position?

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple, and the interview process was easy. Management was very nice and was open about the great things about the job and the nit and grit about the job. Such as being a transporter sometimes you take the brunt of it from the surrounding staff and the patients if they had been waiting a long time for your arrival when in honesty the RN forgot to put in the transport request, or they put the wrong info in.
Interview Questions: Name a time you provided excellent customer care.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Gilbert, AZ) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: First had a phone interview (screening) the person went into detail about the position that I was applying for and at the end asked me for questions. Once I got a call back later that week I had two in person interviews. They were quick to respond!
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Projec Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Job candidates are required to submit a resume and application through their online careers job website.  Afterwards, it takes about two weeks for their Human Resources depart to contact the candidates to ascertain if the person is still interested in the open position and then to schedule an interview at their main corporate office in down town Phoenix.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for Banner Health

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (New York, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initially contacted by a recruiter describing the unit I applied for and asking why I wanted to work here and describing my experience. Next step was an in person interview with the unit director.
Interview Questions: Behavioral based questions

title: Information Security Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. In person interview, 30min and straight forward. They called me, and told me to come in for an interview the following week. It was fairly straightforward, and hit or miss questions. A lot about policies and procedures.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with HIPAA standards and practices?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call from a recruiter, and went through a brief phone screening process. Then the in-person interview was scheduled with the managers.They were very friendly and polite. Got an offer call an hour after I left the hospital!
Interview Questions: How did you manage the conflict? What can you bring to this organization?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: applied online...uploaded resume....HR called and asked a few preliminary questions like: Are you available to start a job now?  What was your last wage? Do you have reliable transportation and child care.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your last job?

title: IT Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The first call was from a recruiter who as the "tell me about yourself" questions.  Next, they moved me to the second step or F2F interview  The interview was casual 1:1 setting. I didn't find it very difficult to navigate through the interviewers questions.
Interview Questions: How do you go about getting information from users? What is your role?

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Banner Health (Sun City, AZ) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple , i went in the interview very nervous but turned out to be really nice and calm. The gentlemen who interviewed me was polite and kind. Asked simple questions.
Interview Questions: Can you handle being around traumatic situations such as (sickness , heart attacks , death , blood) ?

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process was wonderful.  They really made me feel warm & comfortable.   I knew right away this was the place for me.  I'm so excited about my future.
Interview Questions: Why would I be a good fit.

title: IT Network Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very simple interview. Just one over the phone interview, but there was an extremely extensive background check. Felt like I was applying for secret clearance. After the phone interview, I didn't hear from them for about a month.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time you failed at your job.

title: Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had mate with manager and clinical coordinator,I tell them my work history and interest to the job and company.We had identified the employee which work in the company in the pass and precent time , with  whom I had experience to work together.The atmosphere of interview was friendly after all.
Interview Questions: How you will deal with difficult physician?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview with recruiter and then had two face to face interviews with the hiring manager. It was a great experience.  The team was nice, the interview went well.  I decided not to take the position because the salary was just too low.  If they provided a counter offer at a higher salary, I will take the offer.  The company and employees were great.
Interview Questions: Provide a situation in your past where you had a specific problem with a supervisor, and how did you handle it?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the job and got an interview within a week. The began the interview by explaining the job, then they asked about 8 behavioral questions. The whole interview took 30 minutes. They called me back the next day with an offer.
Interview Questions: Can you think of a time there was conflict between coworkers? What did you do? What was the outcome?

title: Chaplain Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Started with an initial phone interview.  Mostly wanted to verify experience and information on the resume.  Then got into more specific questions.  Most questions required lots of examples to answer.  First talked with human resources who then refers to department.  Long drawn process and very hard to get any information along the way.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a disagreement with someone you worked with, and what did you do about it.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very positive and friendly. The manager was very caring and I felt really comfortable. I got a tour of the unit and the people I would possibly be working with. I was very confident and felt that I would get the job.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The nurse managers I interviewed with were so nice and down-to-earth. They were making jokes and laughing, which made me feel comfortable and less intimidated with them and about the entire process. After the questioning they took me around the units to show me where I would be working at.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself. Talk about a conflict you had with a coworker. What would you do if a patient reported having chest pain?  How do you  organize your shift? Why should we hire you? Do you have EKG reading experience? Tell us about your strengths. Name 2 weakness of yours.

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and then a phone interview followed by a panel.  Updated website with status of interview.  That was nice because you new where you application was in the process.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions. Such as tell us a time when ...... Happened? How did you react.

title: PCU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied on-line, screened over the phone, and attended a panel interview. Personnel were friendly and made the situation very comfortable. Offered the position and A date to start the following day.
Interview Questions: Situational and behavioral based questions. For example, "How would you handle a patient that is angry with you?", and medical scenarios.

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Banner Health in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Long and tedious no follow up after submitting resumes. Put in app. On line. Possibly get a call, maybe not. Stupid questions asked. Did not go over in detail the benefits even after I asked. Seemed not to know the answer.once again they move very slow to extend interviews and offers.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to work with a difficult co-worker

title: Planning Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy- came in three different times. 2 one on one interviews and one panel interview. The panel interview consisted of more of the same behavioral type questions where specific examples were requested.
Interview Questions: All experience focused. Describe a time when....

title: PFS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Denver, CO) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a very long process.  Had to fill out a very long application with personality quiz.  Had to go through drug testing, back ground check  and immunization verification.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Gilbert, AZ) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initially a recruiter calls and screens you via telephone. They then set you up for an interview with the hiring managers and give you the time, date and place of meeting.  Panel interview by three department heads. Two different units were interviewing candidates for accurate fit/placement.
Interview Questions: All managers were very pleasant, professional, and engaging. They took turns asking the questions and then gave me a tour of one unit at the end of the interview session.  I was called back with an offer within an hour after leaving the facility!

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral interview. Recruiter did a phone screening and then set up an appointment to meet with a panel of three people. A director, an associate and a manager. They took turns asking questions, which you can find good guidelines online to help you through this process.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would confront a direct report about an issue.

title: IT Desktop Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Banner Health in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: After applying via their portal online, I was contacted by a recruiter who then said I would have an over-the-phone interview with the hiring manager of the department. Phone interview led to a scheduled in-person interview a week later and was conducted by a department lead as well as the department manager.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you encountered a situation that needed to resolved and describe your logic.

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health (Gilbert, AZ) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from Banner HR. No phone interview. They just set a time for the interview. Panel interview with two of the transport managers. Pretty basic behavioral questions about 5 questions. Joe wrote notes the whole time. Kellie asks the questions. Both are very nice and friendly. Just be calm and come prepared for behavioral style questions. Took about 20 minutes. I was told they would call me sometime in the week. She called like an hour later and said I had the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you and a coworker worked well together.

title: IT Service Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: First begins with phone contact from recruiter, then is provided a time for a manager to contact via phone for a quick phone interview as well. In-person interview was VERY structured and was a round between two (a manager and a lead) from the department with very basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation that was difficult to accomplish and the logic used to accomplish or satisfy the goal.

title: IT Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with the entire development team and the director of the team. They took turns asking behavioral and technical questions. After questioning, they took me to an office and gave me test problem that they wanted pseudo code solutions to. Received a call in about 2 weeks with an offer of employment.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to deal with a difficult situation and how did you handle it?

title: Child Life Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Two phone interviews, one right after the other. First was HR second was the Child Life manager. The one with the child life manager was unexpectedly Skype and was very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to relocate?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Greeley, CO) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Went through a recruiter. They forwarded my resume to hiring manager.  All done through a recruiter. The challenge is getting through to a recruiter and actually being able to physically talk with someone.  I went through the website and the careers area.
Interview Questions: The questions are all related to behavioral situations and examples of times you did something.

title: Clinical Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Informal to start and then progressed to formal averaging 8 hours with physicians, managers and staff that would be managed. Opportunity given for this role with hiring Director aware of applicants work experience. No direction or mentoring for the role once hired making success difficult at best.
Interview Questions: Why are you suited for this role.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: two managers began with casual conversation, asked about me as a person.  they said tell us whatever you want about yourself, could be professional or personal. After 10 min or so they said now they will begin the interview and referred to questions on a form they both held.
Interview Questions: What didn't you like about your last position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was so long ago, I don't really remember all the details. They made me feel welcomed and it was a good experience. I recommend this company to others
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Regulatory Affairs Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: First call to go over location and pay cap with recruiter (very nice lady). 4 person panel interview the next day.  They were very nice and warm. Two supervisors and two team members.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Fort Collins, CO) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with three people asking questions and reviewing resume. They were approachable and nice, wasn't too stressful.  There is a high demand for medical assistants right now so they were fine with me being fresh out of school.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in health care?

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: pretty routine. in person with manager and 4 team members.  It did take a bit of time to get it scheduled as they had to coordinate their schedules.  There were folks in the conference room and people on the bridge line participating from other locations/other states.  Interview was behavioral based question questions--they had a list that they would take turns reading questions.
Interview Questions: Give an example of when you had multiple priorities, and how do you select on what to do first.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Multi-tiered interview process - phone, video, in person.  Individuals and panel.  Very open discussion. Questions about background and interests. Description of role and expectations.  Questions about working in a complex organization.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a really hard time getting an interview with no experience as a new grad about 6 months of applying on my own. I had to know somebody to get my resume handed to the hiring manager. After that I waited about 3wks for a phone interview. The in-person interview consisted of 3 managers. I was hired in 2days.
Interview Questions: All the questions were behavioral/situational "tell us about a time you had a difficult pt what did you do.." All these questions need a beginning middle and end.  I followed the questions on here and there were not any surprises.

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Quick, HR was on top of the applications within a week or less, and I was in for a face-to-face interview in a week and a half. Two interviews- one with HR rep and one with hiring manager for the department.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you made a mistake in a workplace. How did you deal with it and what was the result?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: first, banner staffing will contact you and notify when management can meet for an interview. With in person interviews, the first one is just with the clinical manager, the second in-person interview is with a few of the employees who work on the floor.
Interview Questions: How do you go about a situation where you and another coworker do not see eye-to-eye?

title: Managing Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviews with HR/recruiter, supervisors and colleagues. The initial and colleague interviews were conducted via the phone. Interview with practice leadership was conducted in person. Most interviews were conversational in nature, very few behavioral questions, but the one that were related directly to past work experience in consulting or industry specific scenarios. With the right experience, the questions were very easy to answer.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would analyze and communicate results to the client for a given project.

title: Room Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Glendale, AZ) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Online application, phone interview, in person interview with department manager.  I was asked a few questions and then received a call a few days later.  From there you have to get an occupational health physical that is paid for by the company.  Along with going to HR downtown to take your photo and sign some paperwork.  Before you can begin work you have to go the orientation downtown and then at the hospital location you were hired at.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to deal with an upset customer.  Do you have experience in healthcare?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Informal Panel of Management and Piers. Questions were of a general type and were a combination of Project Management technique and personality questions. It was an enjoyable interview and the panel was friendly and talkative. It was not formal and intimidating. I think the panel was looking for a good "Fit" in the organization even more than specific project management skills.
Interview Questions: Describe your project management methodology

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, had a phone screening interview with the recruiter initially, then using behavioral based questions, a one to one interview with my direct manager occurred. If i were applying to a manager position, a panel interview would have happened as swell. All in all, it was a short process.
Interview Questions: Describe an instance when a change was being implemented but you didn’t agree with

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online was contacted by recruiter two days later. Information forwarded to hiring team. Contacted by hiring team the following week to set up interview. Interviewed with 3 people in department. Brought letters of recommendation because there was nowhere to upload online. Met others in department after interview.Offered position 20 minutes after interview.
Interview Questions:
Describe a time you made a mistake, how did you handle it?
Describe how you work with a person you don't get along with.
Have you ever had to work with someone who does not do their share of work?

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The processes started a little slow as I waited for a couple weeks before getting an initial contact.  Once the process was started, it went quickly until fruition.  I found that the negotiation process was not much of a negotiation at all but the recruiter was professional regardless.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an encounter where you had to lie a co-worker?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Gilbert, AZ) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two interviewers with pre set questions. Questions were situational based and not experience based. They did not ask for a resume or about previous work experience. I received and offer three days later and accepted. The whole process took about a week and I had orientation two weeks after I accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you had to work in a team?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was taken into a room with two managers. We all sat and they asked me various questions. Afterwards, they said I would receive an email in a few days. Very easy process
Interview Questions: customer service experience and would I be ok with the various job duties

title: Patient Financial Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call the next day to schedule a phone interview.  I completed the phone interview and was asked to schedule a face to face interview with a group of managers. I attended the interview which took about 30 minutes or so. There was a total of 4 manager 3 of which asked various questions and one that wrote down responses.  I received an offer for employment a couple days later.
Interview Questions: What do you have to offer to banner?

title: Endoscopy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: A current employee interviewing for this position by the department manager. With several openings I was not offered any. The manager was not welcoming and I knew from the start I did not have a chance. I was ask situational questions.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a surgeon who is being difficult

title: Department Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Sun City West, AZ)
Interview Descriptions:
Application process begins online. He calls to screen, then sets up an in-person behavioral-based panel interview consisting of a series of "describe a time you did....", "Tell us about a challenge you had... What did you do?", etc.
HR contacts you to make an offer. They are very matter of fact; there is no negotiation on salary. 
After acceptance, there is a background and drug check.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a challenge you had with an employee. What did you do?

title: Patient Financial Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Queen Creek, AZ) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application through the Banner website, i was contacted by a recruiter the following day.  The recruiter conducted a phone interview which lead into an appointment for a 1:2 interview at the facility. The interview was scheduled 2 days out.  When i arrived for the interview, there were 2 people doing it.  I was asked a series of behavioral questions and then a string of "what if's".  A good chunk of the interview was "tell me a time when..."  A focus on past relative experience was discussed as well as education accomplishments. Once the interview was done, i was told i would be contacted by the recruiter.  6 days later, i got the call and was offered a position.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you were in charge of a group of people over a project.  What did you do to make the project a success and would you change anything?

title: PFS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Standard  interview and they asked lots of situational questions. The environment was pretty laid back and relaxing. Staff was very friendly as well. The interview  process was more of a discussion than the typical interview. Each member of the panel took turns asking one of the specific questions which I responded to. They even provided the time for me to ask any questions and took the time to clarify some of my conerns.
Interview Questions: What are your strenths?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: After a short phone interview, I interviewed with a staffing specialist where we discussed my goals and reviewed openings that I was qualified for. Interview questions were mostly behavioral based. Describe a situations where... There was only one non behavioral questions. Having a one on one interview instead of a panel interview made me feel much more comfortable.
Interview Questions: Name 5 places where you can find patient information in the work place.

title: Secretart Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. I came in and met the department head and his assistant; got the job later that day. I accepted the offer and started my new job two weeks later.
Interview Questions: The pay that I was looking for. What hours I was available. What computer software was I familiar with.

title: ER Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Sun City West, AZ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The people at Banner Del Webb seemed to really like it there. There were 2 people interviewing me. One seemed to be displeased that I was a new graduate. They wanted to impress that as an ED nurse you need to have more general knowledge than the specialist nurses.
Interview Questions: what do you think a nurse in the rn is like?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Overall process took 2.5 months from application to first day at work.   After the Phone Interview with the recruiter they lined up a first interview with the person who would be my boss.  That interview happened 2 weeks after the recruiter call.  After that, they decide to narrow the field and callbacks scheduled for 3 weeks from first in-person.  Next interview was a panel format with the manager, his manager (director level) and the team lead.  Job offer came a week after that with start date two weeks later.

First in-person was the manager getting a feel for whether he wanted you on the team, second had more of the direct-duty questions from their technical lead.

Pay is unfortunately a bit low for the position and there's not a lot of room to negotiate, although I did talk them up a bit from their initial offer (couple K).  

Extremely formal environment, everyone wears dress pants and button downs daily, Khakis are rarely seen and Jeans are forbidden.
Interview Questions: Why I left my last two jobs since both were about 1 year stints

title: Practice Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: quick in scheduling and following up to the interview, appropriate  questions for the position, they make you feel welcome, and show attention during the interview. they were professional and courteous.  Gave a detailed description of the position and expections.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you had a difficult employee, what did you do to help them overcome?

title: Patient Financial Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: First a phone screening and then an in person interview is scheduled. After the face to face interview, I received a call from a recruiter offering me a position. Once accepted, additional paperwork was completed to start the extensive background check.
Interview Questions: Describe a time there was a miscommunication in the workplace

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Greeley, CO) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a phone call for a brief phone interview within a week of applying. This was followed by an in-person interview with the department head. Very undiscriminating and I didn't feel a lot of pressure. It was a good conversation.
Interview Questions: What are you going to bring to the role?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was a telephone screening. Then I was called for the in person interview. I was interviewed first by the Chief Financial and Administrative Officer. She basically went over the job details and company overviews. Then I meet with the HR director. She went over a set of questions testing my skills. I thought it went really well. I was leaving town to go to NY for a month which I told them. I got a call 2 weeks later for a phone interview. I had that with a doctor which went just ok, it was hard over the phone. They called me back and said they wanted to do a Skype interview wit the doctor but then two weeks went by and I didn't hear back from them, so I thought I didn't get it. I came home and got called on Thursday for another interview onsite on Friday. I thought it went really well but I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: They asked me what I would do if a skilled nursing facility would not discharge a patient ( rehab patient who was medically ready on day 6 ) . It was a Friday and the doctor would not be in again until Monday. They wanted to keep the patient for the 20 days that medicare would pay them.

title: GraduateCorporate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I have hired from my college, one of professors interviewed me.
It was Data Analytics role so I had resume review and questions about predictive modeling and exploratory data analysis. Interview process took just one day and it lasted for 1 hour.
Interview Questions: How can you use exploratory analysis to build a predictive model

title: MEDICAL BILLING Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Fort Collins, CO) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was very unorganized and contradictory.  

The expectations of the employees is unreasonable.  The management is very frugal to the point that no benefits are offered.  The Management dress code requirement was also unreasonable as the term osha was mentioned; however, the management team was not following the outlines dress code.  A medical insurance allowance was mentioned in the handbook; however, the practice no longer offers this benefit.  Nearly every item listed in the handbook was contradictory to what was actually being practiced in the work place.
Interview Questions: Can you be here on time since you'd be commuting?

title: Labor and Delivery Surgical Technologist I Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: I have been is this department since 2002 and working for Banner Health since 1998.  I am actively seeking full time employment elsewhere because of low census.  Banner will hold on to your file and use it against you during an interview.
Interview Questions: Any thing that goes wrong, than its my fault that It was not checked.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Questions are mostly behavioral. Panel interview with three managers. They have a list of questions approximately 6-8 questions. Relaxed atmosphere. Fee questions about clinical experience. The interview lasted for 30-45 minutes.
Interview Questions: What was thre most challenginn experience you had and how did you overcome it.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: very easy, they ask basic questions about yourself, and how well you work with others, your flexiablility and how you handle certain situations. how long you done this and why you want to work with banner health, your future goals and test your phlebotomy skill on fake arm
Interview Questions: what color tube for PT

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Banner Health (Greeley, CO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Dishonest, recruit for multiple candidates and positions for high level skill set then before the ink hits the contract, retract and say do not need the higher skills set so will cut your salary, but in a month do need the skills set and do not pay you for the service provided. Sad and dishonest.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to live in Greeley, CO?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received a call from HR about a week later setting up an interview. Interviewed with the managers. Everyone was very easy going. Typical behavioral questions. What would you do in this situation, tell me a time this happened...etc.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions. Tell me a time when there was an issue with your coworker.

title: Talent Sourcing and Recruiting Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process is different for every team and facility. The recruiters horribly screen candidates via a new personality questtionaire rating system which if you do not score above the 65 threshold score you will be immediately rejected unless you have the qualifications they are seriously desperate for; then they can get a waiver for you. The majority of recruiters are terrible and are basically glorified appointment setters.
Interview Questions: Scripted and rigid questions like: Tell me about a time you overcame a challenge you had at work.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Pretty laid back interview style. It was very conversational; almost felt like I had the job during the interview. The offer and on-boarding process was long. Took two months after the initial interview to start the position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from an HR recruiter, which then asked me a series of questions(10-15 minutes). She offers an interview 1:2 with the Transport Supervisors. One week later, I received a call, offering me the position. I accepted the position. For a position that's considered "entry level" they took the hiring process pretty serious.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you knew something went wrong, and you were the first one to know about it.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Took about two weeks to get a call from HR. HR asked about five easy questions about background and history. Scheduled an in person interview for the unit with the nurse manager and CNL.
Interview Questions: Behavioral Questions: Tell us about a time in which you and a coworker came from different backgrounds and didn't get along. How did you deal with the co-worker and what is the end result?

title: Undergrad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Overall, it was a fairly standard process. A few directors ask you work related questions and personality related questions. They may or may not have one of the younger people on the panel as well. The questions are very generic and easy to answer if you have real work experience. They don't grill you or anything like that. Thankfully there were none of the goofy questions you read about...
Interview Questions: What is a weakness you have?

title: Digital Media Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview was friendly and provided insight into what the job entailed. Took a long time to hear back. Corporate world takes weeks and sometimes months to get a response. Exciting to interview for a big medical company.
Interview Questions: Difficult challenge in field of work and how did you overcome it?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had an initial phone screening with a recruiter after submitting application. After that I had one interview with the director of my department. Following that I had another interview with the director and others who were already in the role I was applying for. Following this, an offer was extended, and I worked with the recruiter on all details.
Interview Questions: What was one piece of advice that you received from a previous manager?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Application was submitted on a Sunday, was called back the next day(Monday) and did a quick 3 question interview with HR. After was asked to come in for an in person interview Tuesday and received a call Friday offering the position.
Interview Questions: All behavioral based interview which is pretty standard for healthcare jobs.

title: Patient Financial Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: They called me back 2 weeks after applying and never heard back. I was calling and emailing with no reply. Then after a month later I called and she told me the position had been filled.
Interview Questions: How are you with being able to discuss large amounts being owed to the hospital.

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Banner Health in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: The recruiters were easy to talk to and immediate in their followup with email information about my interview. They provided company information, asked what questions I had, and answered honestly and thoroughly. Next steps were clearly detailed and completed as indicated.
Interview Questions: The vision of the company was stated and I was asked to respond how I would implement or contribute to that vision.

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Fairbanks, AK) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had a super formal interview with the manager at Home Medical in Fairbanks.  Then had a panel type interview where I was grilled on my credentials (I'm from another country) and my dedication to getting my American credentials.  It was less about my skills and more about how I looked on paper.
Interview Questions: When are you getting your American  credentials? What's the number to the governing body? I would like to verify your information. Who did you talk to there?

title: Patient Financial Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied got a call 5 days later had interview with four managers was told i would hear from them in a week never received a call from them and it has already been 3 weeks. Checked the status on my application on the website and it still says pending hiring team review
Interview Questions: Explain a time that you went above and beyond for a patient and What was the outcome

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I started with BSS (staffing service). The interview process was quick and easy. After initial acceptance of job offer, it takes about 30 days to finish the on-boarding process. I was offered a core position withing 2 weeks of my first assignment. I have enjoyed the ride.
Interview Questions: my experience in handling sensitive and difficult situations

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interviews are behavior based questions.  It may be that you get more tgan one i terview depending on the position. Pretty easy overall, the interviews last about 45 mins
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you didnt get a long with some one.

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: applied online received a phone call to have an interview. we mostly went over on how the hiring/ interview process would go bc of the new company that bought them out. she than asked me about my work history and the different units and campuses they have, finally she asked me a few behavioral questions. said they would call me for another interview if they were interested. received another phone call a few days later to set up an interview date. i go in and sit in front of 3 nurses (each manger of their units), each one asked me some behavioral questions. when we finished they said that the different units would take a look at my application and if they like me they will interview me with nurses and techs from their floor..
Interview Questions: they asked: describe a situation where you and a co-worker did not see eye to eye and how did that effect the way you worked and what did you do to resolve the situation and if you were to go back in the past would you handle situation? how do you handle mutli-tasking and how do you handle it?

title: Ultrasound Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral based interview with many scenario-based questions.  I had two phone interviews, then a panel interview with 10 people on the other side of the table.  Each took turns asking behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond for an employer.

title: Informatics Analyst Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Banner Health (Greeley, CO) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with manager and team. Was a fairly straight forward interview with a variety of questions from the panel.  Knowing each of the members made the process much easier and less stressful
Interview Questions: How would you handle a conflict with a fellow co-worker?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Behavior based questions, about 20 of them. Not too difficult, but it probably is better to have an answer for each question, than to not. just say strong key words that they are looking for, like quality, driven, excellence. they look for these three things while interviewing: Energy, enthusiasm, and excitement.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Filled out plenty of online applications. Was under review for about 3 weeks.  Was called in to come and interview. Met with a recruiter first and answered basic questions, preferred schedule, any weekly obligations, etc.  Also had to answer how I will uphold their mission statement.  I met with 2 unit managers from 2 different units and answered about 7 or 8 questions.  Very simple.  Just no chemistry with the unit managers.  It was a mass interview they were interviewing people from 7 am to 5 pm and i felt they were bored by the time it was my turn.
Interview Questions: What words do you use to convey safety to a patient?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online from my phone after quitting my previous job and was called writhing 2 hours for an interview.  I showed up the next day and was asked some scenario questions then given a job offer. I started training within two weeks.
Interview Questions: What is the last department you worked in a hospital?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: I completed an application online.  I received a phone call for an interview.  I had one interview and a job offer within a few days.  I brought copies of my resume,  letters of recommendation and current certifications.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were  mostly behavior based questions.

title: Cashier Culinary and Nutrition Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2014

She asked about previous experience I had in this role and how I would apply this to my current role.  She asked what I liked and disliked about my previous employer.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Banner Health (Fort Collins, CO)
Interview Descriptions: This took forever initially and then they wanted me there in a very short time constraint and ready to travel immediately.  It took 3 months or more to get the real phone interview, then an onsite.  Offer letter was not complete as the moving expenses were not mentioned and after hire they added an addendum saying you had to stay one year or pay back.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Banner Health (Glendale, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Always find out the director/manager of the department you are hiring for and send them a personal resume and cover letter and possible call. HR very understaffed and may not respond or delete your resume.

title: Registered Nurse CVICU Interview

After discussing the open position, the senior manager asked specific questions about experience and ability to move to Arizona.  Some discussion regarding compensation and Banner Health.

title: ICU RN Interview

Candidates were brought in on a schedule and interviewed.  This was a large new graduate hiring event.

title: Registered Medical Assistant Interview

title: Patient Financial Services Supervisor Interview

title: Human Resources Interview

title: CNA Interview

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Anyone can get hired everything was easy nothing to worry about. I feel like that hired anyone because they need people to do the ugly work and I worked with a lot of people who the next day quit

title: Nurse Interview

title: Business Support Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: I applied, had to interview with a recruiter the typical corporate questions...  Tell me about a time when...got an offer on the spot and accepted.  When through an extensive pre-employment background check and drug screen.

title: Room Service Assitance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Sun City West, AZ) in Jan 2014

Interview Questions: what i did do when working as a caregiver

title: ER Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Glendale, AZ) in Dec 2013

Did go over purpose of the company, what I was hoping to get out of the company, and what I can bring to the company.typically lasts about 40 minute up too 1 hour.
