title: RN, Clinical Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Glendale, AZ) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I spent two hours with a hiring manager in her private office discussing the job and how the unit functions.  She asked me several behavioral questions that stimulated me to think of how I would act as a manager based on how I was treated by managers in the past.  I was prompted to think of past experiences and bring it to the table and describe exactly how I would react in a similar situation and how I would make decisions and deal with staff as a clinical manager for their unit on night shifts.
Interview Questions: My most difficult question was "how did I act in the past to assist to resolve a difficult situation which resulted in an improvement of patient care while working a shift.  How did I make a difference in the patient care and improve the communication among the team members of my shift.

title: Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: It went very well, everyone was very positive and willing to bring me to the team. Everyone was so easy to talk to & I did not feel like I was on a interview. It wasn't like many others, I was very comfortable. I would recommend to work at Banner Baywood Medical Center.
Interview Questions: When can you start?

title: Director of Corporate Facilities Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process was lengthy as would be expected and very thorough in nature. I believe recruiting for Banner did a stellar job of identifying candidates. However, during the process in more than one interview with the department head, that same department head was dozing off. In fact he had to excuse himself from the interview to get up and "go to the restroom." Upon returning he opened a desk drawer and removed a 5 hour energy from an assortment of energy boosters and water additives. He was still unable to maintain interest. This should have been an indicator when in the second of the interviews he conducted himself in the same manner. I came very well prepared and put in a great deal of effort to be at my best. This, should have sent up the red flags, "The culture is, I don't care."
Interview Questions: Describe some of the strategies you have used in the past to develop connections with other departments, businesses, or community leaders, and discuss how you were able to cultivate these connections into partnerships. Did you ever face a situation where others had conflicting agendas, and how did you handle this?

title: MA/Reg Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Banner Health in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied and was called 2 days later. Interviewed over phone with a recruiter then scheduled a one on one with the clinic director. It has been 2wks with no update I try not to be pushy or annoying about it but I'm itching to know when they will be making a decision or a 2nd interview.
Interview Questions: Not difficult, typical behavioral questions and availability.

title: Culinary Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Get through the brick wall of recruiters, typical behavior-based questions. All questions are off a matrix.
Interview Questions: Typical behavior based; how do you work in teams, what did you do when a project didn't proceed as intended, tell about a time when you had a conflict with a coworker, etc.

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call from the recruiter in about 5 days.  You must know someone as a referral to get your application pulled.  I have applied about 20 times before and never received a call, so knowing someone at Banner is vital.  Scheduled a phone interview a few days later.  Pretty basic questions some behavioral questions, but nothing to difficult.  I then was ask for a 2nd interview with the Nursing Manager I would be working for.  The Nurse Manager was very warm and really wanted to get to know me better.  It was one of the best interviews I've had.  Behavioral questions were the main focus but they also lead to a discussion about past experiences.  One week later I received a call and was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you were in a group and what role did you have and the outcome of the project.

title: ER Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty easy. I applied online got a call from the talent recruiter, she set up an interview with her first then brought me to the nursing manager. By the time I got home I got a call saying they wanted to offer me the job. My advice is to get the talent recruiters name --- she/ he will be your best friend.
Interview Questions: What made you want to apply for this position? Tell us about a time a patient was upset how did you handle the situation? Etc.

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview process. Asked a few questions on how I answered certain situations. Asked why i thought i was a good fit at Banner Good Sam. They also warned that the job could be a little graphic, which is totally true. Warned about having to take bodies to the morgue
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you succeeded under pressure

title: Medical Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a friend who worked there at the time, so it was fairly easy to get an interview. As it was not a highly skilled position, only requiring some common sense and attention to detail, the questions were pretty straight forward. They wanted intelligent, careful people.
Interview Questions: Please give us an example of a time when you saw that a co-worker had made a mistake and how you dealt with the situation.

title: Service Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a short phone interview and then a in person interview. The interviews in the service department were always with 2-3 people from upper management, almost felt like an intimidation tactic.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you were challenged and how you handled the situation?

title: Clinical Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was rather quick and a smooth transition, the culture is very friendly and belief that the patient comes first
Interview Questions: I felt the questions were straight forward and expected

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with manager along with staff member from unit.
Interview Questions: What have you done to improve the function of your unit?

title: Rrt Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Called in and sat before the director and manager
Interview Questions: Tell us a time when you did not agree with your supervisor or manager?

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I first received a call from HR for a  Phone Interview, 2nd- I was scheduled for a Panel Interview with three Administrators  and the last interview I was scheduled for another Panel Interview with three Managers.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had to analyze information and make a recommendation. What kind of thought process did you go through? What was your reasoning behind your decision?

title: Systems Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Just before the interview the hiring manager called me and asked if I needed support for employment visa. He said they would not be able to support it. There is no point to have the interview.
Interview Questions: What if you have a disagreement with others?

title: Nurse Pre-residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Banner Health in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I requested a Banner facility for my senior practicum because I knew that they had a good track record with hiring new graduates. They refer to the senior practicum as the "nurse pre-residency program," and admittance into this program required an interview. It was a panel interview (3 interviewers) which I initially found intimidating, but they were kind and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time when you made an error.

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Friendly but you better know your stuff. Such as CPR and the human anatomy your responsibilities if you are FO or BO and how close are you going to be working with Doctors. What each floor is and how they work.
Interview Questions: What does a lateral index finger look like?

title: Home Health Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Banner Health (Gilbert, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Was hired over the phone.  Supervisor was then fired before I started.  Worked without a direct supervisor for months after hire..
Interview Questions: Questions regarding how you would handle a scenerio.

title: Medical Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions:
Very lengthy and detailed
Online application only, followed by interview by recruiter to verify information
Followed by background check
Interview with potential supervisor/manager consisted of obscure questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you lead a group through a discussion that changed the direction of a project

title: RN Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Banner Health in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard situational based interview in which I was asked questions about weaknesses, strength and scenario based dilemmas which I would answer what I would do with the certain situation.
Interview Questions: I don't remember the specific question but it was something related to a future goal or committee that I felt I could start that would be beneficial to the company.

title: Senior Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Banner Health in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Pre-screening phone interview asking basic questions about work history, then a three person panel interview with senior members. Second interview was also a panel interview with peers. Both interviews had behavioral questions about leadership examples and why I would want to work for Banner. Have several stories in your back pocket if you want to be prepared.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you disagreed about a company decision, how you handled it, and what was the result.

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed
Interview Questions: Can you work independently

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health
Interview Descriptions: Submit an application online, Takes 15-20 min. A representative from HR will call and set up and appointment. Go in and be interviewed by the director of the department. If you get the job the HR rep will call you back within a aforementioned time frame. It is then that you will get all the details, including salary offer, etc.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you preformed excellent (above and beyond) patient care and how did you know it was excellent.?

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Multistage interview process.  Initial phone interview with talent acquisition followed by interview with the Director then panel interview with the team. The team interview required a presentation in which I was told I had to teach the group something they didn't already know and or present on something I was passionate about.
Interview Questions: If you could do anything without any limitations such as gravity, needing to breath, or even being human what would you do and why?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Had five interviews, absolutely ridiculous!!! 
It was intimidating, I was laughed at during interview, had nurses with much less experience by years questioning my abilities, knowledge, capabilities, problem solving and critical thinking abilities.......and shockingly this was allowed by upper management, as the norm!!! No feedback given just drilled like I was applying for the Army or the DOD. It was absurd, waste of time and it appeared the staff enjoyed it at Banner Thunderbird.
Interview Questions: If you observed a nurse stealing drugs or abusing a patient how would you handle it?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Quick, already knew I was picked. I was hired once as a staffing contract person, then as an aide on the floor. They told me on this floor to apply, so I knew that I already had the job. The interview was fast. The first time I was asked no questions when I got hired as a staffing services CNA.
Interview Questions: What do you do to juggle your time for time managemebt

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: 2 Part interview process.
Interview Questions: What is the biggest decision you've had to make in the past year?

title: Business Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview first started with another company, which went very well. All was organized and very professional. Follow-up was conducted in a timely manner. People were great and friendly. Instructions were also very clear.
Interview Questions: What type of background skills do you have that fit the job opening?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Contacted to setup one interview. After attending this initial interview, which was one-on-one, I was scheduled for a follow-up interview. The second interview was a "panel" and containted six senior nurse-managers. Both interviews consisted of behavioral interview questions and neither contained any "typical" questions (i.e. weakness, strength, leadership, why this field, though they did ask "Why you?").
Interview Questions: Describe a 9 or 10 patient experience.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got a call/phone interview, scheduled in person interview, had in person interview which was very comfortable, maybe 30-45min, got the job offer call before I got home, went through occupational health requirements, background and paperwork requirements, started training a few days later.
Interview Questions: What are you strengths and weaknesses?, Explain a time when you had a difficult situation with a coworker and how you handled it., Explain a time when you had a difficult time with a patient and how you handled it, Why do you want this position and why you think you're the best for it.

title: Staff Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Meet with HR then move to department interview. Then moved on from there to a tour and then met with other people in my department. The only thing that would make it a lot of fun and easy to get a job at the hospital is being friendly. I applied online.
Interview Questions: How do you like people?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Banner Health in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: a few managers and a few fellow employees in a conference room. it was pretty brief and to the point, i think it lasted about 30 minutes total. not a lot of small talk or "get to know you" questions
Interview Questions: very typical interview questions, such as 'explain when you had conflict with another employee' etc

title: Human Resources Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process had it's pros and cons. The application online is very time consuming and could be organized better. It does not give any room to individualize answers and explain how you can provide value to the company. It's very much a screening tool. The interviews (phone and 1:1) were alarmingly easy.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions at all. Interviews were entirely scripted and quite mundane, which in my mind, makes it extremely difficult to differentiate between candidates or learn anything about their ability to communicate or think on their feet

title: Imaging Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter called for phone interview, hiring supervisor called for phone interview, 1:1 interview
Interview Questions: Standard questions

title: Program Director Strategic Planning Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interviews with recruiter and then hiring manager.  Group interview with other dept members.  I didn't get an offer due to lack of experience but was given good feedback.  All around positive experience.
Interview Questions: How many windows in the Empire State building.

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: First interview with HR then hiring manager then given a tour of facility That is all that I have to say my interview process was very long ago and I do not remember specifics at this time.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions and critical thinking

title: Executive Chef Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Banner Health (Surprise, AZ) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Basic three interviews... HR, Group Panel & Director. I meet with the HR department and did a one on one- that lasted about an hour. I waited two weeks before I heard back for a second interview with some of the staff from the dietary department. That went really well, I was able to relate to the staff. One question I remember from one of the staff was " are you fair"? Lastly, I heard back after another 2 weeks to schedule a interview with the department director. I thought that went really well.... it must of, I got the job. I started about a month later.
Interview Questions: HR was more about education, experience and personality. Panel was more of my management style and with the Director was more about what I can bring to the team.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Banner Health in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was friendly. They do behavioral interviewing so be prepared. They ask for additional information if they think you are too brief. The first phase was a telephone interview then I was called back in for a face to face.  The telephone was one person. The face to face was a panel of three people. They explained everything about the position.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you disagreed with your manager.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and inviting.  Professional and courteous.  The interviewing staff made me feel welcome enough to allow myself to fully express my expectations and questions about the position.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had to deal with difficult customers over the phone?

title: Registered Nurse ICU Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: You were interviewed by your peers, and you were asked questions about random scenario's that were meant to explain how well you would cover up for a manager, doctor, or administrator in the event of a medical error. Patient safety was less of a concern as ensuring that management "looks good" and you voice "their wonderful accomplishments" even if it is only lip service. Many of the bedside nurses leave everyday hoping to not lose their nursing license, because they have one nurse to 7-8 patients, and 2-3 managers for every bedside nurse.
Interview Questions: If you noticed that a patient was not getting adequate care what would you do?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was impressed with the professional and personal attention to assist in the interview process which I find to be nerve-wracking.  My supervisor was professional  knowledgeable and understanding.
Interview Questions: Personal preference to Independent worker or team player

title: ED Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health (Glendale, AZ) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I found the job announcement from Indeed.com; applied through Banner's website.  A few weeks later I was contacted by human resources to schedule a phone interview.  The phone interview consisted of general questions.  Scheduled an Interview with Nurse Manager.  The employees there were very kind, made me feel comfortable.  I was not prepared for the 3-part behavioral interview questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time when you experienced miscommunication.  How did you handle it? How would you prevent it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was straight forward. After meeting with human resources, you get scheduled for an interview with the director and employees in the department. Interview can be 1:1 or panel format.
Interview Questions: Why would you consider yourself an asset to this organization?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Relatively easy, interviewed with the ER Director. He was impressed and offered me a position before I even left the parking garage to head home. I accepted the offer and have worked with Banner since.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a perfect fit for the position

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Glendale, AZ) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Came in and interviewed with Supervisor and 2 other pharmacy technicians.  They asked me some questions about my experience with my previous jobs and how would they benefit with me at this job here at Banner Thunderbird.
Interview Questions: Do you have any hospital experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral Based questions
Interview Questions: Behavioral Based questions

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: First worked as a temp. Then got an interview with lead supervisor after 90 days  for FT permanent position.
Interview Questions: I don't remember. It was all about job performance and how well you worked with and got along with co-workers!

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Banner Health in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed me over the telephone, offered me the position several days later.  There was no negotiating salary, you either took the position or declined.  They interviewed me on a Friday night around 8 pm.
Interview Questions: None, they are pretty generic

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions - i.e., "The mission of Banner Health is [insert mission here]. How do you see yourself fitting into that mission?" "Give us an example of a challenge you have overcome in your previous employment."
Interview Questions: The challenge question always gets me.

title: Intake Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had 1 interview with Banner Health and was hired.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Started out at a temp, or "travel nurse" so I was already acquainted with the hiring manager. Interactions were not intimidating, or "scary" more than the norm.  I was basically offered the job before the interview so the formal setting was brief and only hospital policy basically.  The interview consisted of reasons I became a nurse, expectations for my role on the unit, and some real life field Q & A.  
Give comprehensive answers that  exemplify "A" quality nursing and you will fit into the Banner quality standards for hire.
Interview Questions: A situation where there was conflict with a staff member/ colleague that required some sort of intervention on my part.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Glendale, AZ) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: I applied for more than 15 jobs until finally getting an interview. Interview was with the senior clinical manager and he was kind. It was very relaxed and the interview went well.
Interview Questions: All questions were your normal interview questions. Nothing crazy, not trying to stump you.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Banner Health in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: After filing out online application, I received call from HR. One stop shopping- Human Resources immediately took me to talk with Unit Director for interview and tour and I was called the next day with job offer contingent on background check and pre-employment physical.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Nov 2008
Interview Descriptions: Interview very easy going, no new tactics, it is one on one.
Interview Questions: Questions on customer service only

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: I was applying consistently on-line for 1.5 years before I accepted this position.  I had 2 interviews, total.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Banner?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Interview process included 1:1 interview with supervisor and group interview with peers. HR Interview, Physicial, Drug Test, TB Skin Test etc. Banner is a great place to work and I highly recommend a job at Banner Health.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your work history

title: Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: There was a departmental group interview after an initial phone screening.  It was a very standard process and more just about how the department felt about the candidate.
Interview Questions: Name a time when a situation didn't go as you planned.

title: BHT Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Banner Health (Glendale, AZ) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with 3 different people, we talk about my experience, education, and family, my advice is be yourself and remember they are human just like us,
Interview Questions: What is your education and work experiences

title: Patient Accounts Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Banner Health (Phoenix, AZ) in Dec 2007
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with supervisor and separately with manager. Straight forward questions. No situational questions. Test was simple math. Process was positive and expectation was a positive outcome.
Interview Questions: How do you solve problems?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Banner Health (Mesa, AZ) in Oct 2007
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from the nursing recruiter, answered a few questions over the phone and set a date for a 1:1 interview.  The interview lasted about 10 minutes and from there I started filling out the paper work and did a brief computer based competency tests, such as standard precautions, HIPPA etc,
Interview Questions: Why did you quit your last job?
